She is asking for a loan in order to be able to pay the tuition for her degree program.  In this way she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her degree program in accounting.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es una persona que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrea de contabilidad y comenta que su meta es graduarse y trabajar en el rubro, de ese modo ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus útiles de universidad, como libros fotocopias y otros.
texts.en: Adriana is from the city of Lambaré.  She is a person who is putting forth her best effort in order to be able to grow and get ahead.  She is studying towards a degree in accounting and comments that her goal is to graduate and work in her field.  In this way she will be able to help her family.  She is asking for a loan in order to pay for school expenses, such as textbooks, photocopies and other items.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses, such as textbooks, photocopies and other items.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas para poder ser una profesional útil para las demás personas.
El gracias al apoyo de su familia está luchando para poder conseguir sus metas. Está esforzándose y lucha cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera para poder crecer y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Nery is from the city of Viallarrica.  He is studying Business Administration in order to become a professional who can help others.  Thanks to the support of his family he is working hard to be able to achieve his goals.  He is pushing himself and struggling each day.  He is asking for this loan in order to pay tuition so that he can grow and accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a degree in Business Administration.

loans.name: Đông

texts.en:
Đông is 30 years old and she is married. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture, farming food for seven years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Đông's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Đông hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yurielka Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (JHONDRA, LISSETTE DEL SOCORRO y REYNA)  que se organizaron hace 12 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Jhondra: Es una joven luchadora, tiene 24 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 2 años, vende productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogos de manera ambulante. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: perfumes, vanidades, pinturas de labios, de uñas, sombras, cremas corporales entre otros productos, con los 2 créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le permitieron surtir su pequeño negocio y poco a poco mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella sueña con tener su tienda y exhibir sus productos en vitrinas de vidrio.
texts.en:
It consists of three determined women (JHONDRA, LISSETTE DEL SOCORRO y REYNA) who organized themselves 12 months ago with the purpose of obtaining financing for their small businesses, increasing their incomes, and improving their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic needs at home, ensure their children´s education, and expand their businesses. 

Jhondra is a young fighter, 24-year-old single mother of a small 3 year old. In order to get ahead for her son, as of two years ago, she has sold beauty products and cosmetics by catalog and as a street vendor. She is requesting her third financing to buy in Managua: perfumes, vanities, lipsticks, nail polishes, eye shadows, body creams, among other products. The two previous loans by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva, have allowed her to stock her small business and gradually improve her quality of life. She dreams of having her own store and displaying her products in glass display cases.

loans.use: to buy in Managua: perfumes, vanities, lipsticks, nail polishes, eye shadows, body creams, among other products.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 22 mujeres, todas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que han visto una gran oportunidad de crecer y ayudar a sus familias por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Rufina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es la Tesorera del grupo ella se desempeña como modista y se describe como una mujer luchadora y capaz para poder salir adelante y necesita el préstamo para poder comprar una máquina, telas y otros artículos y así poder sustentarse. Es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y crecer.
Ella esta poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder ser de ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 22 women, all of whom are very hard-working and entrepreneurial.  They have found a great opportunity to grow and help their families via Kiva field partner's projects to eliminate poverty. 

Rufina is one of the members of this group.  She is the treasurer and works as a seamstress.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman who is capable and wants to get ahead.  She needs a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, and other articles in order to sustain her business.  She is a fighter who wants to move forward and grow.  She is putting forth her best efforts in order to help her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, and other articles in order to sustain her business.

loans.name: Lọc

texts.en:
Mrs. Lọc is 40 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years.

Lọc lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, this job is unstable.
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Lọc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Lọc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Koeju” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4  de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Toribia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema, luchando por poder mejorar cada día.  Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas variadas y con ello tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, esforzándose por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called "Koeju" is in its first loan cycle with Kiva partner's program for women. All of the women promise to work and to help each other in order to get ahead.  They are participating in a study related to eliminating poverty, and 4 of the 19 women find themselves living below the poverty line, that is to say they are living in extreme poverty. 

One of the group members is Toribia.  In her responses to the study survey she demonstrated a level of poverty characterized as level one, which means she lives in extreme poverty.  She is struggling to be able to improve every day.  She works selling various types of fruits and by this means earns the income to support her family.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy fresh fruit so that she can continue with her sales.  She is pushing herself for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, a la vez que estudia también trabaja para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Esta cursando el tercer año de la licenciatura en contabilidad, y por medio de sus conocimientos quiere abrirse camino al mundo profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles, como ser libros, fotocopias y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maribel is from the city of Curuguaty. She is simultaneously attending school and working in order to improve her and her family's living conditions. She is in her third year of an accounting licensure program. Through her knowledge, she hopes to open doors for herself in the professional world.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover the cost of supplies, such as books, photocopies, etc. so that she can continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to cover the cost of supplies, such as books, photocopies, etc.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Artik town and is the father of a newborn son. He currently lives with his wife and son, because his parents left the country many years ago with the hopes of sustaining their son financially.

Hovhannes himself, as a hardworking and enthusiastic young man, has his own business and earns his living. Using his own car, he works as a distributor for one bakery and also drives a taxi. Because the car works all day long, it needs to be renovated. Hovhannes is asking for this loan to pay for the renovation of the car to be able to continue his work as a a driver.

Hovhannes has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Hovhannes hopes to receive lenders' support and has many hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de diciembre está en su ciclo número 18 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas están saliendo adelante.
Marta esta la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que siempre es ejemplo para sus demás compañeras del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, tiene una gran variedad, y con sus productos tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con una mayor cantidad de prendas, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, blusas, vestidos y otros.
texts.en:
The group "8th of December" is in its 18th loan cycle in the women's group program, where they all work and help each other to succeed.

Marta is the president of this group. She is a very-hardworking and determined woman, who always is an example for her companions in the group. She makes a living by selling clothing of all kinds. She has a great variety, and with her earnings she has the means to provide her family a respectable life.

She is requesting this loan in order to stock up on a larger quantity of clothing, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothing, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres unidas forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas están esforzándose por poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguelina es una de las que integran este grupo, ella tiene un modesto copetín que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y lucha por ellos. Miguelina está luchando y quiere seguir capacitándose, es por ello que pone todo lo mejor de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de progresar y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas [United Women] is part of the program to eliminate poverty. All of them are making an effort to help their loved ones through their work.

Miguelina is one of the members of this group. She has a humble little restaurant that she managed to start with a lot of effort and sacrifice. She is a woman very dedicated to her family, and she fights on their behalf. Miguelina is working hard and wants to continue establishing herself. For this reason, she gives her very best.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy groceries, drinks, sweets, and other merchandise for consumption, so that she can continue her sales as she has. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to progress and improve.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, sweets, and other merchandise for consumption

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 21 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lourdes.
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, comenta que tiene muchas ventas ya que tiene siempre todo tipo de productos y eso gusta mucho a sus clientes. Lourdes está luchando y esforzándose para poder mejorar y con su trabajo ir superando su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Lourdes  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos tales como: frutas, verduras, carnes, panificados, arroz, yerba, entre otros lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Todas están contentas por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que podrá seguir ayudando a su familia con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This group, Mujeres Emprendedoras, is in its twenty-first cycle, of the women's committee program, where everyone helps each other to get ahead. They are now applying for one of their members, Lourdes. 

She sells all kinds of basic products. She comments that she has lots of sales because she always has all kinds of products, and her customers really like that. Lourdes is struggling and working hard to improve her business and lift herself out of poverty. 

Lourdes is applying for this loan to purchase products such as: fruits, vegetables, meats, baked goods, rice, herbs, among other things which will enable her to solidify her business plan, and increase her earnings. Everyone is very pleased with the opportunity they have been given, which allows them to help their families by striving to succeed with their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, means, baked goods, rice, herbs etc. for resale

loans.name: Flaminio

texts.es:
El Sr. Flaminio  tiene  43 años, vive con su señora y sus hijos tiene un puesto en el mercado hace más de 20 años, se  dedica a  vender choclos y verduras varias. El comenta que tiene ya una clientela formada. Gracias al trabajo que está  realizando puede llevar una vida digna y darle un techo a su familia.
El préstamo lo pide para la compra de verduras frescas para la venta, para poder seguir con su negocio y luchar de esa forma para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Flaminio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and sons.  He has a stall at the market and has been working there for 20 years.  He works selling shoes as well as vegetables.  He comments that he has a stable client base.  Thanks to his work he has been able to provide his family with a dignified life and a roof over their heads.  

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase fresh vegetables for resale.  This will allow him to continue with his business and in that way be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak is from Artashat and lives with his mother, wife and two kids. 

Sahak is a dentist with 10 years of working experience. He is the only breadwinner of the family and works hard to manage to cover the family's daily costs. 

Sahak asks for this loan to purchase special tools needed for providing dental service to the patients. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is Sahak's first deal with Kiva, and he hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for special tools needed for providing dental service to the patients

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is 39 years old, and she is a single parent with 3 children. She has been working in agriculture for 14 years, raising poultry.

Liên lives in Ha Trung district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoá province. Her family's household is low-income, in village, and, moreover, her job is unstable. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Liên is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Liên's hopes are for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her kids. With her business profits, she hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alicia Isabel

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad Alicia es una señora casada, tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes porque ya trabajan, Alicia vive con un hijo, una  hija, una nieta  y su esposo que es jornalero, Alicia creció en el campo y comenta que toda su vida a obtenido sus ingresos del jornal de actividades de agricultura, de la ganadería y de la venta de la leche. Alicia solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca para ordeñarla y realizar la venta de la leche. Lo que Alicia espera de su negocio es comprar más  vacas y lograr con este negocio obtener mas ingresos para salir  adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Alicia is 52 years old, married, and has four children who are all grown and independent because they all have jobs. Alicia lives with a son, a daughter, a granddaughter, and her husband, who is a day laborer. Alicia grew up in the countryside and says that she has earned money all her life from working in agriculture, like working with livestock and selling milk. Alicia is asking for a loan today to invest in purchasing a dairy cow so she can sell the milk. Alicia hopes that her business will grow and she will be able to purchase more cows and be able to get her family ahead in life with the income she earns.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Raul Francisco

texts.es: Raul es un señor casado, su esposa se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Raul tiene 5 hijos de las edades de 13, 21, 24, 26 y 17 años. Raul vive en el campo y para sacar adelante a sus hijos siempre se  dedica do a trabajar a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, Raul solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar una vaca ya que con la venta de la leche es como se financia para pagar de todos los gastos de sus hijos. La aspiración de Raul es la de mejorar su negocio y continuar con este ya que este es que le ha permitido sacar adelante con sus hijos, sobre todo pagar los estudios de sus 2 hijos que aun están estudiando.
texts.en:
Raul is a married man, whose wife earns a daily wage working in agriculture. Raul has 5 children aged 13, 21, 24, 26 and 17. Raul lives in the countryside and in order to provide for his children he has always worked in agriculture and in raising cattle.
Raul asked for the loan money to buy a cow because selling the milk is how he funds paying for all of the expenses of his children. Raul's aspiration is to improve his business and continue with it because it has permitted him to provide for his children. Above all he wishes to pay for the studies of his 2 children who are still in education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Elber

texts.es:
Elber es una persona muy trabajadora, hoy tiene 31 años, comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva le fue de mucha ayuda y ha podido mejorar bastante. Se dedica hoy a la venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos, y con su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder comprar productos para la venta, como ser artículos electrónicos y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
texts.en:
Elber is a very hardworking person. At present, he is 31 years old. He says his previous loan from Kiva was very helpful and he has been able to improve quite a lot. Nowadays, he works selling electronics on the streets, and with his work, he has the means to be able to help his family.

He is again requesting this loan to be able to buy products for sale, such as electronics and others, and thus be able to carry on with his effort and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy electronic items and other products for sale.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en: Tehmine ended her first Kiva loan and this deal was so nice and profitable for her that she decided to have one more partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon. She lives in the village of Aknaghbyur in the Tavush region of Armenia with her husband, three children and parents-in-law. Tehmine continues to take care of her farm and nice orchard, which makes the main part of her family income. From the farm with the help of her husband she sells milk, meat, eggs, peaches, persimmons, plums, figs, apricots, and apples. Tehmine’s husband has a job which he combines with farming; he has his own minibus on which he transfers passengers from the village to Ijevan city and back. This time Tehmine is asking for this loan for her farm enrichment. With this loan amount she wants to buy a cow for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle. She and her big family are thankful for the support of all the Kiva lenders beforehand.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 43-year-old married woman from a village near Tulkarm City. She is the mother of three sons and four daughters. Her husband works as a worker where they get a low income. Maryam opened a sewing workshop in her house. She makes traditional clothing. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Maryam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. This will improve her work quality and also her income.

Maryam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 39 years old and she lives with her daughter and son and her mother-in-law in Varser village, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Gohar’s husband now is in the Russian Federation and from there he tries to sustain his family needs, while Gohar both works at the bread factory as a baker and is also good in agricultural work. Gohar’s children are both students; her daughter studies at the Pedagogical Institute at the faculty of Russian Language and Literature, and her son studies at the Polytechnic Institute at the faculty of Architecture. Both of them are very clever and prudent children eager to have a good education.

Gohar is asking for this loan in order to pay tuition fees for both her daughter and son for the second semesters. As she says, it is a really great hardship for her to pay for the education of her two children, but simultaneously she is very proud since both her son and her daughter like the professions that they have chosen very much.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for both her daughter and son for the second semesters.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is 30 years old and married. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband doesn’t work. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. She is skilled, respected, honest and also a responsible and professional person.

Leyli is a dairy farmer. She started keeping dairy cows 10 years ago. Ever since she has developed and grown this business steadily to a point where she is able to get more then 12 litres of milk every day that she sells to her society. Leyli started this business with an amount of capital. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve and expand her merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed her to expand her sales volume. Leyli has already borrowed loans from Agroinvest in the past. Now she needs money and wants to buy food for her cows. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows

loans.name: Haykaram

texts.en:
Haykaram lives in the village Gagarin of the Gegharkunik region with his wife and two children. His son works as an electrician and his daughter is school-aged. Haykaram has worked as a worker at different factories, but now all day long he takes care of his farm, where he has a cow, a calf, a bull, heifers, a pig, lambs, bee families and also chickens.

The sale of their farm products is the only and the main source of income for the family. With his wife Haykaram sells his farm’s milk, meat, macun (national dairy product), eggs and honey. He sells all these locally both to his regular customers and also to his villagers. Haykaram will be happy to have this loan as he wants to buy one more cow for his farm, which will increase both the assortment and also the quantity of the dairy products that he sells.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region with his big family. Nelson has three children and numerous family needs and education costs for his children as well. This is the reason that he does his best to develop his farming and agriculture, which is now the only source of income for his family. On his farm he has cows, calves, heifers, sheep, lambs and chickens. With his wife he sells a great assortment of meat and also milk and eggs from the farm. On his plot of land Nelson cultivates potatoes and sells them to re-sellers every week. Nelson is asking for this loan as he needs to buy potato seedlings and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Calal

texts.en:
Calal is 32 years old and married. He is a father of one son and one daughter. His wife doesn’t work. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He is a skilled, respected, honest, and also responsible and professional person.

Calal is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 12 years ago. Ever since then, he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then ten litres of milk every day that he sells to his society. He started this business with an amount of capital. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to improve and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume.

Calal has already borrowed loans from Agroinvest in the past. Now he needs money and wants to buy food for his cows. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for his cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the cost of installing sewrage pipes

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is a distributor of different types of food supplies in Kapan town. He purchases items in bulk and resells to local shops, using the truck in the photo.

Sergey lives with his wife and two kids in Kapan town. He works hard to provide them with appropriate living conditions. By applying for this loan, Sergey asks lenders to support his business. He wants to purchase new stock of food supplies (candies, cookies) to sell to the shops and get income as a distributor.

Sergey has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

He hopes to receive your support and boost his business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of food supplies (candies, cookies) to sell to the shops and get income as a distributor.

loans.name: Joelle

texts.en:
Joelle is a 27-year-old single energetic, artistic lady who developed her drawing skills and hobby to do remarkable artwork.

Joelle attended a drawing school and took the necessary training and improved her talents. Currently, she runs her business from her parents’ house, and has done so since 2004.

Her area's municipality and the artists in her region like her work a lot, and they rely on her for several occasions.

Joelle is working on expanding and developing her work; thus for this reason, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary painting and artistic materials and tools to open her own working place "atelier". She believes that this must be her first step forward towards spreading her name in the region.

loans.use: to buy necessary painting and artistic materials and tools to open her own working place "atelier".

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta es una gran mujer de 39 años de edad, ella se encuentra muy satisfecha por la inversión que pudo realizar gracias al apoyo que obtuvo con el crédito porque con ello logro aumentar sus productos de materia prima para la elaboración de jaspeado, ahora sus condiciones de vida han mejorado mucho porque ya cuenta con más clientela por lo que sus ingresos han mejorado, pero Marta con el afán de seguir prosperando solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno porque este terreno es muy importante para ella para aumentar el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is a great woman who is 39 years old and very satisfied with the investment that she made thanks to the help of the loan she obtained. With the loan she was able to increase her amount of raw materials to make marble. Now her living conditions have improved a lot because she has more customers so her earnings have increased. 

Marta is eager to continue thriving so she has applied for a loan to buy a piece of land. This land is very important to her because it will increase her children's assets.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Bayandur

texts.en:
Bayandur is a 36-year-old father of a son and a daughter. His wife doesn't work. An IDP (internally displaced person), he lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. 

Skilled, respected, organized and stable, Bayandur has been a farmer for 12 years but is not happy with his work because he cannot earn an adequate income. He is therefore requesting this loan to buy fruit and vegetable seeds that he will sow on his land for later sales.

Bayandur's biggest dream is to expand his land and to plant more seeds.

loans.use: to plant more seeds

loans.name: Segundo Rodrigo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 24 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad pucarapamba, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca maltona para mejorar su ganado y la producción de leche y queso, realizara la compra en Guaranda, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para construir la casa, el desafio al que se enfrenta es el clima y en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a su familia.
texts.en: Segundo is 24 years old. he is married and has 4 children. He lives in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar in a community called Pucarapamba. He works in agriculture and raising livestock. He is requesting a loan to buy a young cow to improve his herd and production of cheese and milk. He will make the purchase in Guaranada. His dream is to buy a plot to build his house. His challenge is dealing with the climate. He likes to be with his family in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
From a village near Hebron, Nawal is a 35-year-old married mother of one daughter. Her husband works but earns a low income. Nawal opened a sewing workshop in her house where she makes traditional clothing. It is a good business that supports her family with a good income.

Nawal requested a USD loan from FATEN to help her buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. This will improve her work quality and also her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es de la ciudad de Pilar, comenta que tiene una hija, trabaja en una empresa de materiales de construcción como repartidor.
Actualmente está cursando la carrera de técnico de establecimiento ganadero y desea terminar su carrera y luego seguir estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, para luego desempeñarse en forma independiente en su profesión.
Es una persona muy sacrificada y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the city of Pilar. He has a daughter and works at a construction materials company as a deliveryman.

He is currently pursuing a technical degree in cattle farming. He wants to obtain the degree and then continue his study in the Business Administration. This will allow him to be independent in his profession.

Miguel is a very self-sacrificing person. He requests a loan to pay for the degree and to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Ramsah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ramsah, one of Ruma's agents. Ramsah lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about a five hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. A happily married man, he owns a stall where he sells small snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for his community.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ramsah sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Ramsah improve his business as well as his community, which needs access to such services. 

Ramsah is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his village community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 57-year-old father of five children. He works hard as an employee in a municipality since 2001, with a limited monthly salary.

Jihad has special needs that limit him from achieving certain things, but he is a courageous man who doesn't like anything to stand as an obstacle in front of him. He is an optimistic person, who believes that everything happens for a reason.

Today, Jihad is acquiring a loan from a program specifically designed for people with special needs from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for necessary requested home maintenance expenses he has to do soon.

He hopes that he can always be capable of providing his family with a healthy way of living.

loans.use: to pay for necessary requested home maintenance expenses he has to do soon.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco vive con sus padres y trabaja  en el negocio de la familia, ellos se dedican a la compra-venta de maderas.
Está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y comenta que sus metas futuras son la de trabajar de forma independiente, seguir estudiando  y ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos siempre lo han apoyado en todo.
Él está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer  y salir adelante, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar útiles para su universidad, como libros y otros. Agradece por esta ayuda que recibe.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his family and works in the family business. They buy and sell fruit.

He is studying Psychology. He commented that his future goals are to work independently, continue to study and help his parents as they have always supported him in everything.

He is putting all his effort in trying to grow and get ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy university supplies like books and others. He is grateful for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy university supplies like books and others.

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd who sells household supplies at the central city market  Nelya has  run this business for 8 years and sells plastic bags, paper towels, napkins, toilet paper, gift packages, and toys.. She is married and has a grown daughter.

Nelya is seeking a loan of 20 000 UAH to purchase disposable plastic bags.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of plastic bags.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla sigue luchando para poder terminar sus estudios y convertirse en una buena profesional que pueda ayuda a las demás personas que necesite de sus servicios. Comenta que su préstamo anterior fue para el pago de su tesis, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para el pago de los gastos que implica la defensa de su tesis, para que con ello pueda terminar su carrera y recibirse. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Pabla continues struggling to be able to complete her studies and become a good professional who can help others who need her services. She says that her previous loan was for the payment of her thesis, which was very helpful to her. 

Today, she is requesting a new loan for the payment of the expenses involved in defending her thesis, so that she is able to complete her studies and receive her diploma. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay expenses for her thesis.

loans.name: Heriyanto

texts.en:
Heriyanto lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about five hours from the capital city of Jakarta. He is happily married and has a cute son. He owns a stall to sell mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. 

Heriyanto sees improvements in his business, thanks to Ruma staff. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Heriyanto improves his business and  his community because they need access to such services. 

He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La  Sra. Rocio es funcionaria pública y gracias a su trabajo por la noche asiste a la universidad, está estudiando la licenciatura en asistencia social.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Está muy agradecida por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Rocio is a civil servant and thanks to her job, she attends university at night. She is studying for a degree in social work. 

She is a very responsible person and dedicated to her studies and to her family. She aspires to be a successful professional and to continue studying and serving others.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay school fees and thus to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is married with two young children. He lives in Pavlograd. He has owned a small vending stall at a local marketplace for 3 years to sell doner kebab, felafel balls, and Lavash wraps to market customers.  Fluctuating currency has affected his business and  prices on groceries and spices increased dramatically.
 
Ramzi requests 10 000 UAH to grow his business and expand his trade. He is planning to open and decorate a small cafeteria. Ramzi wants to make the cafe his second vending location. He is hoping to offer a variety of eastern cuisine dishes which would surprise Ukrainian customers.  Ramzi currently rents  a facility for his cafe.

loans.use: to open and decorate a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Tobia

texts.en:
Tobias is a 30-year-old married man with 3 children. He has had a motorcycle business for 5 years and will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle to serve more customers, increase his income, and support his family. He will use the generated profits to educate his children and open a new business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful, earn more income, and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cariño Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres (Aurelia Magdalena, Laura, Santa  y Veronica) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos, ropa usada y joyas; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

Con los créditos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le ha permitido surtir sus pequeños negocios, incrementar sus ingresos y poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Aurelia Magdalena: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Cariño, con cualidades de líder, es una señora jovial de 33 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 7 años de edad estudia su tercer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, vende ropa usada en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is comprised of 4 women (Aurelia Magdalena, Laura, Santa and Veronica). They are ethnic Miskito from the city of Bilwi, located in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work every day with the determination to achieve growth of their small business of commodities, used clothing and jewelries. They were organized as a solidarity group about 1 year ago in order to obtain loans through Pana Pana.

Previous loans granted by PANA PANA and funded by KIVA enabled them to supply their small businesses, increase revenue and gradually improve the quality of life for their families.

Aurelia Magdalena is the coordinator of the solidarity group Cariño. She has leadership qualities. She is a 33 years old jovial lady, married and has 2 children. The eldest is seven years old and in third grade. Younger child is 2 years old. In order to contribute to household expenses and education of their children, she sells used cloths in a section at the markets in Bilwi. She requests a loan to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua. She hopes to be a successful trader.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 38-year-old married man with 3 children ( 2 attend school) who lives in  Fortportal, Uganda. Patrick has worked hard to manage his spare parts business. 

Patrick requests 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy more spare parts, generate greater profits, and increase his income. Patrick hopes  to increase inventory. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is a 43-year-old married rice farmer with four children, and she resides in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. For more than 25 years, she has cultivated rice. Her husband is also a 36-year-old rice farmer .Two of her children are working in a factory and another two children attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Em is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, so her child will be able to have better traveling conditions. In the future, Em hopes to have enough money to buy more farmland, build a new proper house and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Elsa Veronica

texts.es: Elsa tiene 20 años de edad es soltera vive con su madre en la comunidad Pucarapamba en la provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, solicita el crédito para la compra de lo necesario para sembrar papas en mayor cantidad para una mejor producción, realiza las compras en Guaranda cada semana, su sueño es tener una casa y  tener mas sembrios, el desafio al que se enfrenta es el transporte por que no existe frecuencia, en su tiempo libre le gusta hilar y tejer.
texts.en: Elsa is 20 years old and is single.  She lives with her mother in the Pucarapamba community in the Bolivar province.  She makes a living in agriculture planting potatoes.  She is requesting the loan to purchase what is necessary to plant potatoes in greater quantity for a better production.  She makes her purchases every week in Guaranda.  Her dream is to have a house and have more sown fields.  Infrequent transportation is a challenge she faces.  In her free time she likes to spin and weave.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Rowena support the family through her buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her son Reymund, 17 years old and is 1st of 5 children in the family, who is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the 1st of this 4 year course.

Rowena is borrowing PHP9000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Reymund for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Reymund plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay her son's college tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Criminology

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 48 años de edad, no estudio está acompañado, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos están acompañados y son independientes, los otros dos son menores y le ayudan a trabajar a él en la agricultura y la ganadería.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 25 años, le ayudan sus dos hijos menores y su compañera de vida.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaquilla, aprovechando la época en que hay pasto en abundancia y así mejorar la producción. 

Los planea de José son, tener cuatro vacas de ordeño y mejorar la producción para obtener mayores ganancias, para darle la oportunidad de estudiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old, is not studying, is married and has four children. Two of them are married and are independent, the other two are minors and they help him work in agriculture and livestock.

José has made a living working in agriculture and livestock for 25 years. He is helped by his two minor children and his life partner.

José needs a loan to purchase a cow, taking advantage of the season in which there is an abundance of grass and therefore will improve production.

José's plans are to have four milking cows and to improve production and increase profits, in order to give his children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Saeful

texts.en:
Saeful is a Ruma agent who lives in Cirebon, a village located five hours from the capital of Jakarta. He is happily married and owns a stall to sell snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. 

Saeful sees improvements in his business, thanks to assistance and support from Ruma’s staff. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will  help Saeful improve his business and provide much-needed access to his community. 

He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his village.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a  Ruma agent who lives in Cirebon, a village  located  five hours  from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Anwar is happily married and has a  cute son. Anwar works as an employee for a private company and sells mobile airtime credits for his community. 

Anwar sees improvement in his business and will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Your loan will help Anwar improve his business and provide needed access to his community. 

He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Diki

texts.en:
Diki is a Ruma agent who lives in Cirebon, a village  located  five hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married and has a cute  child. Diki owns a stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. 

 Diki sees improvements in his business and will use the loan to provide  mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will help Diki improve his business and provide needed access to the community. 

He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Pakuaynongbone Group

texts.en: Khamsing is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Khamsing and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Khamsing and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamsing and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamsing and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Glades

texts.en:
Glades is a 48-year-old married woman with 2 school-aged children who lives in Fortportal, Uganda. Glades has worked hard to manage her retail shop for 4 years and sells soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, and curry powder. 

Glades has requested 4,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy more soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, and curry powder,  generate greater profit,  and increase stock. Glades hopes  to expand her business. 

Glades is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Glades who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, and curry powder.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children (3 attend school) who lives in the town of Fortportal,  Uganda.  Margret has worked hard to manage her retail shop for 7 years and sells soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, curry powder, and bread. 

Margret requests 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy  soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, curry powder, and bread, generate greater profit, and increase stock. Margret hopes  to expand her business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margaret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more soda, beer, water, baking flour, beans, curry powder, and bread.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 29 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her saloon, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy treatments, retouch chemicals and will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and increase family income. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosemary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy treatments, retouch chemicals for her beauty salon

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in children and women clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and increase family income. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more women and children's clothes for sale in her store

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 33 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar,millet flour,cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,millet flour,cooking oil, and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and increase income. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, millet flour, cooking oil, for sale in his store

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rubindi in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mathias has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential home items. 

To help expand his business, Mathias has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential home items, and will help Mathias to generate greater profits and increase capital. Mathias hopes that in the future he will be able to make more profits. 

Mathias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mathias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more essential home items for sale in his store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is married and he makes traditional cheeses and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow.   Carlos learned about the cheese business when he was a kid so he knows what to do.

 Carlos is the father of one kid and his wife helps him with the farm but right now Carlos needs a loan.  He and his family are healthy so Carlos hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to continue making traditional cheeses

loans.name: Pozi

texts.en:
Pozi is 33 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Pozi has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Pozi has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Pozi to generate greater profits and increase stock. Pozi hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock. 

Pozi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pozi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy more produce

loans.name: Emine Berrin

texts.en:
Emine is married and a mother of two.  She is making contributions to the family budget by making and selling authentically embroidered wedding dresses.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy velvet fabrics and silver threads, make more wedding dresses, make more money and expand her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Emine hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evinde yöresel işlemecilik olan nakış işi ile yöresel düğün giysileri dikerek aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile kadife kumaş ve sim alarak yöresel giysiler dikerek ve satarak işini geliştirmek ve para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy velvet fabric and silver threads for her embroidery

loans.name: Delmy Guadalupe

texts.es: Delmy de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos varones de 18 y 8 años de edad. Delmy se dedica al servicio de limpieza en una empresa cercana a su vivienda por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de granos básicos a la orilla de una carretera cercana a su comunidad, gracias al negocio y a al trabajo que realiza  Delmy ha podido sacar adelante a su hijos y suplir las necesidades del hogar. Delmy desea aumentar las ventas de sus negocios y para ello solicita un crédito  a FUSAI para la compra de mayor cantidad de granos básicos como frijol y maíz para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Delmy, 45 years old, lives in her own house, is a single mother and lives together with her two sons, 18 and 8 years old. Delmy works as a custodian at a company near her home in the morning and in the afternoon she sells staple foods on the side of a highway near her community.

Thanks to her business and the work Delmy does, she has been able to raise her children and meet household needs. Delmy wishes to increase sales from her business and for this she is applying to FUSAI for a loan, to buy staple foods like beans and corn in larger quantities to increase sales at her business and obtain more income.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of staple foods like beans and corn to increase sales at her business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 58-year-old married mother of five children. She and her husband have a food starch powder factory. They have been working in this factory since 40 years ago. She manages the factory very well and she is always working hard to develop it.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials that will help her increase her production, as she wants to rehabilitate her factory and keep it a healthy place to stay congruent with the ministry terms.

Jamal hopes to expand her factory more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her children's needs and provide them with better living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to increase her production and to rehabilitate her factory

loans.name: Blanca Marisol

texts.es:
Blanca, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, se casó pero está separada de su esposo, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos trabajan y 2 de estudian.

Blanca, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, comenzó este negocio desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño su mamá y desde entonces decidió dedicarse al negocio, porque le genera mejores ingresos; además de la venta de pan, hace pizza, donas y tamales de los cuales obtiene ingresos extras.

Blanca, necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima como harina, aceite y azúcar para elaborar pan.- Con esta ayuda tendrá suficiente producto para la venta.

Los sueños de Blanca, sueña con mejorar las ventas y poner un local en el centro de la ciudad; además desea que sus hijos logren estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Blanca, 38, has a 9th grade education. She was married, but is now separated from her husband. She has 5 children. Three of them work and two go to school.

Blanca makes and sells bread. She started this business when she was 15 years old. Her mother taught her how to do this job, and then she decided to go into business because it generates good profits. Besides selling bread, Blanca makes pizza, donuts, and tamales, from which she earns extra income.

Blanca needs this loan to buy raw materials such as flour, oil, and sugar in order to make bread. With this help, she will have enough product to sell.

Blanca's dreams are to improve her sales and to have a place in the city center. In addition, she hopes that her children can attend college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, oil, and sugar in order to make bread.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, and neither of them is currently in school. 

For the past 2 years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho, and will give him enough stock to be able to generate greater profits. 

David hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a big shop. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 50 años de edad, está acompañada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, uno estudia y el otro trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Catalina, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortas de todo tipo y variedad de bebidas, ella hace las tortas más deliciosas de su ciudad y además es muy reconocida por su amabilidad y carisma.

Catalina, está solicitando el crédito para comprar pan, tortas de carne, salsas, lechuga, tomate, entre otros insumos para elaborar sus tortas.

El sueño de Catalina es establecer su negocio en un local más amplio y quedarse ahí estable.
texts.en:
Catalina is 50 years old, is married and lives with her spouse and their two children. One is studying and the other works and helps with the household expenses.

For 15 years, Catalina has worked in selling tortas [meat sandwiches] of all kinds and a variety of beverages. She makes the most delicious tortas in the city and additionally, she is very well-known for her friendliness and charisma. 

Catalina is requesting a loan to purchase bread, meat patties, sauces, lettuce, tomato and other ingredients to make her tortas [meat sandwiches]. Catalina's dream is to establish her business in a larger location and remain there stable.

loans.use: to purchase bread, meat patties, sauces, lettuce, tomato and other ingredients to make her tortas [meat sandwiches].

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.ru:
Сохибе 35 лет, она мама 3 чудесных деток, старшей дочери - Ситоре 14 лет, она учится в школе, средней дочери - Бегаим - 7 лет, ходит в садик, самому младшему сыну - Азизу 1 год. Сохиба в разводе. Она самостоятельная, целеустремленная женщина, любит порядок в делах и организованность. У Сохибы два высших образования. Уже 15 лет она занимается частной предпринимательской деятельностью - предоставлением парикмахерских услуг (стрижка, женские прически) и косметологических услуг (чистка лица, татуаж и прочее), есть все необходимое образование, салон работает с 8.00 утра и до 21.00 вечера. Ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет порядка 17,200 сом (KGS). 
Но Сохиба не привыкла останавливаться на достигнутом, она старается постоянно совершенствовать свои знания и навыки, участвует в семинарах и форумах. В мае 2015 года Сохиба прошла обучение на тренинге "Бизнес планирование" в рамках конкурса "Начни свой бизнес", проводимом в южных регионах Кыргызстана. Сохиба стала одной из 35 финалистов и одной из 9 участниц, которым был предложен кредит "Стартовый бизнес" на льготных условиях в Банке "Бай Тушум". Сохиба с радостью согласилась, так как ее давней мечтой является открытие нового направления в бизнесе  - преподавание курсов по повышению квалификации. Сохиба будет вести курсы сама, а также нанимать квалифицированных преподавателей. Курсы будут вестись по следующим направлениям: парикмахерское дело, языковые курсы, кулинария, швейное дело, работа с компьютером, бухгалтерский учет. Сохиба уже арендовала помещение, на кредит в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) она планирует приобрести 10 компьютеров, 10 компьютерных столов, 1 проектор и 2 принтера. В классе будут обучаться 8 - 10 человек, Сохиба планирует обучение минимум 2 групп учеников в неделю. Так же для желающих будет проводиться и индивидуальное обучение. Сохиба решила установить конкурентоспособные цены, к примеру стоимость 1 курса обучения  бухгалтерскому учету (3 месяца) будет стоить 4,500 сом (KGS), это очень привлекательная цена для молодых специалистов.  Прогнозная совокупная ежемесячная прибыль Сохибы увеличится до 22,200 сом (KGS), за вычетом расходов по кредиту. 
Сохиба берется за любую возможность развить свое дело или начать что-то новое, прежде всего, чтобы иметь возможность увеличить свои доходы и дать своим детям достойное воспитание и самое лучшее образование. В дальнейших бизнес идеях Сохибы  - покупка собственного помещения и открытие частного детского сада.
texts.en:
Sohiba is 35 years old and has three lovely children. Her eldest daughter, Sitora, is 14 years old and attends school. Her middle daughter, Begaim, is 7 years old and attends kindergarten. The youngest son, Azis, is one year old. Sohiba is divorced. She is an independent, goal-driven person and likes her business to be well organized and efficiently run. Sohiba has earned two college degrees. For 15 years she has been in private business, providing  hair styling services (hair cuts, women's hair styling) and cosmetic services (facials, tatoos etc). She has all the necessary education. Her beauty salon is open from 8 AM to 9 PM. Her monthly revenue is about 17,200 soms (KGS).

However, Sohiba is not used to resting on her laurels. She constantly attempts to expand her knowledge and skills by participating in seminars and forums. In May of 2015, Sohiba has received training in business planning within the framework of the competition "Launch your own business," which was conducted in the southern regions of Kyrgyzstan. Sohiba was one of the 35 finalists and one of the 9 participants who were eventually offered a business launch loan under preferential conditions from the Bai Tushum microfinance institution. 

Sohiba gladly accepted this opportunity since her longtime dream  has been to start a new direction in her business--teaching professional development courses. Sohiba will teach some of the courses herself and also hire qualified instructors. There will be courses offered in the following areas: hairdressing, languages, cooking, sewing, computer literacy, and bookkeeping. Sohiba has already leased the necessary space. She will plan to use her loan of 150,000 soms (KGS) to buy 10 PCs, 10 computer desks, one projector and two printers. There will be 8-10 students in each student group. Each week Sohiba plans to have at least two groups. Individual courses will also be available upon request. Sohiba decided to set affordable prices: for example, one 3-month course in bookkeeping will cost 4,500, which is an attractive price for young professionals. 

Sohiba uses every opportunity to develop her business or start something new, with her main goal being to increase her income and provide a decent quality of life and the best education for her children. Her additional business ideas involve purchasing her own business space and opening a private kindergarten.

loans.use: to start a new business -- specialized education courses -- by purchasing 10 computers, 10 desks, one projector and two printers.

loans.name: Dongwaydin Group

texts.en: Khai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khai and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khai and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sidika

texts.en:
Sidika is married and the mother of three children. She raises chickens and chicks in her garden and sells them and their eggs. People prefer her products because they are natural. With the help of the loan, she plans to purchase chicken feed and increase her number of chickens and chicks.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sıdıka hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Bahçesinde tavuk ve civciv yetiştirerek tavuk ve yumurta satıyor.  Doğal ürünler olduğu için tercih ediliyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile tavuk yemi alacak.  Hedefi tavuk ve civciv sayısını artırmak.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, de 31 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a labores agrícolas y tiene 2 hijos pequeños. 

Rosa, realiza los oficios domésticos de su casa, mientras su pareja se encuentra en las labores agrícolas.

Rosa, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas para darle un buen manejo a los cultivos de granos básicos, ya que depende de la preparación de la tierra para que sea una buena producción.   

Rosa, desea que sus hijos crezcan sanos y puedan prepararse academicamente y sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old, is married, her partner makes a living in agricultural work and they have 2 small children. Rosa performs the domestic chores in her household, while her partner works in farming.

Rosa is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as: fertilizer, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides in order to successfully manage their crops of basic grains, as having a good production depends on the preparation of the land.

Rosa wants her children to grow up healthy and academically prepared, so that they will be successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs such as: fertilizer, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Fatima Yaneth

texts.es:
Fátima, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja para el gobierno, tienen 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Fátima, es la dueña de un cafetín que está en la escuela desde hace 4 años, esto lo aprendió gracias a su mamá, quien tenía una pequeña tienda en casa y a ella le gustó este tipo de negocios y fue por esa razón decidió dedicarse a este negocio, el cafetín está a 4 cuadras de su casa y su horario de atención al público es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. 

Fátima, necesita el crédito para comprar productos para la venta como: dulces, frutas, bebidas y otros; esto le ayudara a tener más producto en la tienda y a surtir con diferentes artículos. 
   
Los sueños de Fátima son, la superación académica de sus hijos y la implementación de un nuevo local en otra escuela.
texts.en:
Fátima, 31, studied until high school. She is married and her partner works for the government. They have 2 children who are in school.

For 4 years, Fátima has been the owner of a snack stand located at a school. She learned this job from her mother who had a small store in her house and who liked this type of business. For that reason, she decided to pursue this business. The snack stand is 4 blocks from her house and it is open to the public from 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

Fátima needs this loan to buy products to sell, such as sweets, fruit, beverages, among other items. This will help her to have more products in the store and to stock it with different items.

Fátima's dreams are to see her children grow academically and to implement a new stand at another school.

loans.use: to buy products to sell, such as sweets, fruit, beverages, among other items.

loans.name: Sabirakan

texts.ru: Сабиракан, 33 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, она уже 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у Сабиракан есть 6 коров, 65 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль - 11,800 сом (KGS). Сабиракан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма на пастбище и реализации. Сабиракан является участником группы "Берлин", всего в группе 3 человека. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние и условия жизни семьи.
texts.en: Sabirakan is 33, married, and a mother of four. She has been earning income for her family by farming for ten years. Sabirakan currently has six cows and 65 sheep. Her monthly income is 11,800 som (KGS). Sabirakan applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy sheep to fatten at pasture and sell. She is a member of the "Berlin" group, which consists of three people. The earnings from the loan will help her improve her family’s well-being and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening at pasture

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married. He sells milk, though he is also a mason. He receives help from his wife, but they do not have children. 

Juan needs a loan to buy a dairy cow because he wants to sell more milk. He learned a lot about this business when he was very young.

Juan hopes you can help him because he puts a lot of effort into his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo is a 47-year-old homemaker who lives with her five children, her husband, a grandchild and a son-in-law in a community in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Her husband is a 49-year-old land broker. Among her five children, two works as construction workers, one is a traditional dancer and also a student and the last two are in school. Together, the family can earn about USD28 each day. 

Sambo is now requesting a loan because she needs finances to buy a motorcycle for her child, who is a traditional dancer, to commute to school and to work. This loan will help her have enough finances to afford a motorcycle and improve her child’s traveling conditions in order to earn income to help support the family. For more future goals, Sambo plans to run a small grocery store at home, save money to build a new house and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to school and to work

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel is married and the mother of three children. After her children grew up, she started to make fabric dolls as a hobby at home. Later, she made money by selling them. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy more fabric, produce more dolls, make more money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Emel hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Çocukları büyüdükten sonra aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak amaçlı hobi olarak yaptığı bez bebek yapımını para kazanır hale getirmiş.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile kumaş alarak bebek yapımında kullanacak. Üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her doll-making business.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 31 год, замужем, 3 детей. Майрам работает медицинской сестрой, также в качестве дополнительного дохода уже 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у Майрам есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади. На 0,40 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль - 9,800 сом (KGS). Майрам обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Майрам является участником группы "Берлин", всего в группе 3 человека. Доходы от кредита позволят Майрам улучшить благосостояние и жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en: Mairam is 31, married, and has three children. She is a nurse and has been earning additional income through farming for ten years. Mairam currently has four cows, twenty sheep, and two horses. She grows potatoes on a 0.4 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income is 9,800 som (KGS). Mairam applied for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy sheep to fatten and sell. Mairam is a member of the “Berlin” group, which consists of three people. The earnings from the loan will allow her to improve her family’s well-being and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, está casada y vive junto con sus dos hijas y su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías religiosas y sus hijas actualmente estudian el bachillerato.

María, se ha dedicado por más de 25 años a la elaboración de artesanías religiosas, las cuales comercializa con la gente que llega hasta la puerta de su casa a comprarlas por mayoreo.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar telas, hilos, agujas y otros insumos para continuar con su negocio.

Ella, sueña con tener una casa más bonita y seguir elaborando artesanías.
