texts.en:
María, 45, is married. She lives with her 2 daughters and her husband. She makes religious crafts. Her daughters currently attend high school.

María has been making religious crafts for more than 25 years. She sells them to people that come to her door to buy them wholesale.

María needs this loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies in order to continue doing business. Her dreams are to have a nicer house and to continue making crafts.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies in order to continue doing business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is divorced and she is in charge of 4 kids.  She is a seamstress and she knits vests, scarfs and gloves in wool.  She is very good at it because she learned when she was a child.

Guadalupe needs a loan to buy more wool.  She would also like to make improvements at her house and to have a little workshop.  She works hard and she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy more wool for her various knitting projects

loans.name: Kader

texts.en:
Kader is a married mother of 2 children. She sells cosmetics either from her home or at stands. Her best customers are hair salons.  

With the help from this loan Kader is planning to buy more cosmetics, which she will sell, earn more money, and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Kader hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Evde ve stantlar da kozmetik ürünleri satışı yapıyor. En iyi müşterileri kuaförler. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile kozmetik ürünleri alarak satışlarını artırmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is a taxi driver and father of three children. He and his family happily live in Kapan town. Using his own car, Nver decided to earn his family's living by taxi driving. He started his work as a driver last years, and over hard and tireless work, he now receives number of orders from clients. 

To be able to renovate the car and purchase new tires for it, Nver decided to take a loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
This is Nver's first deal with Kiva and he hopes to receive lenders' support. The loan will help a lot with the taxi driving business and Nver waits for the support.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and renovation of his taxi

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi is divorced and lives with her son. She owns 2 shops where she sells artificial flowers. Her customers are couples planning to marry. She both designs wedding flowers and makes wedding candies.  

With help from this loan Sevgi plans to improve her designs and her business by buying more flower materials in bulk.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Sevgi hanım eşinden ayrılmış oğlu ile beraber yaşıyor. Yapay çiçek satışı yaptığı iki dükkânı var. Müşterileri genellikle evlilik hazırlıkları yapan çiftler. Bu dükkân da hem çiçek tasarımı hem de nikâh şekeri yapıyor. Aldığı krediler ile çiçek alıp tasarımını gerçekleştirip işini geliştirdi.

loans.use: to buy artificial flowers.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of two. After her husband's retirement they opened a flower shop. Once in a while, she goes to the shop and makes flower designs, takes care of the flowers, and feels very happy with it. Nowadays, she spends all her time and energy on this business. With the help of the loan from Maya she developed her business and expanded her shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi emekli olduktan sonra çiçekçi dükkânı açıyorlar.  Ara sıra dükkana giden Fatma hanım çiçeklerle uğraşmaktan ve tasarlamaktan mutlu olmaya başlıyor.  Şimdi tüm zamanını ve enerjisini işine harcıyor. Mayadan aldığı krediler ile işlerini geliştirdi ve dükkânını büyüttü.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 52 years old and lives in Kisumu town. She is married and together with her husband they support 7 children.

She has a small scale boutique shop, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She will use the loan to buy more stock of clothes for sell and make more income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and expand her business by buying more clothes for sell.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income and be able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sell so as to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Nevin

texts.en:
Nevin is married and the mother of two.  She is selling lingerie to her friends and neighbours from home.  With the help of the loan she is planning to expand her business by buying and selling more lingeie.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nevin hanım evli iki çocuk annesi iç çamaşırı satışı yapıyor satışlarını evde ve yakınlarına yapıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile iç çamaşırı almak istiyor satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for sale to friends and neighbours

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Alfonsina is married. She is a seamstress and she makes baby clothes. Her husband works at a print shop and the couple have two kids. Alfonsina needs a loan to build up a little workshop at her house because she wants to expand her business by making clothes for all ages .

Alfonsina works hard she is healthy and she hopes you can help her.  You can see in the picture at work, where she has little room.

loans.use: to build up a little workshop for making baby clothes at her house

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 33 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. 

For the past seven years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread and posho. To help expand his business and generate greater profits, he has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more such items. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to keep his shop well-stocked. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread and posho

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek is 38 years old and has a child. For four years she has been selling natural cosmetic products. When she started this business she had no money and made sales from the catalog. With the help of the loans from Maya she bought products in bulk. Her customers loved her products, and the number of her customers increased. Melek bought more products with the help of her fourth loan from Maya. She increased her capital and the number of her customers. She wants to save money to establish a good business for her child.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Melek Hanım 38 yaşında ve bir çocuk annesi.  Melek hanım 4 yıldır doğal kozmetik ürünleri satışı yapıyor.  Bu işe başladığında sermayesi olmadığı için kataloglardan sipariş ile satış yapmış.  Daha sonra Maya’dan aldığı kredileri sermaye yaparak ürünleri toptan almış. B öylece müşterileri ürünleri görüp alınca daha çok almaya ve müşterileri artmaya başlamış. Melek hanım Maya’dan 4. kredisini kullanarak daha çok ürün siparişi vererek sermayesini ve müşteri potansiyelini artırdı. Çocuğu için birikim yaparak onu iyi bir meslek sahibi yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a new client in Ugafode microfinance. She is a married woman with children.
She is a business woman owning a retail shop in abid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business.  She has applied for a loan of ugx500,000/= to buy ingredients for her bakery. However she is faced with a challange of competition and lack of enough capital.

Ruth  is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund and sustain her business

loans.use: To buy baking dough and sugar to bake items for sale in her store

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is constructor. He lives and works in Kapan town, with his parents and sister.  He started providing construction works to locals in 2013 and since then has accomplished number of successful projects. 

By applying for this loan, Mher asks lenders to help him to purchase a rotary hammer drill and other tools needed for providing construction works. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

As a hard working and responsible person Mher is sure that hi cooperation with Kiva will be fruitfull and he will be able to make investments in his work.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill and other tools needed for providing construction works

loans.name: Saidabu

texts.ru: Сайдабу, 58 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей, есть внуки. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Сайдабу с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Сайдабу есть 4 коровы, также земельный надел, мерою 1,0 ГА, где она ежегодно сажает клевер для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Сайдабу, ее деятельность приносит около 10,800 сом (KGS) в месяц, в том числе пенсионные выплаты. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайдабу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, а также на посадку и культивацию риса. Доходы от кредита Сайдабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Saidabu is 58, married, and a mother of two with grandchildren. She has a secondary education. She has been farming since 2000 to earn income for her family, having started her business with 15,000 som (KGS). Saidabu has four cows and a 1.0 hectare plot of land where she grows clover to sell. Thanks to her hard work, she earns around 10,800 som (KGS) per month including her pension payments. In order to develop her business, Saidabu applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows and land to grow rice. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her herd and land in order to grow rice

loans.name: Sulaman

texts.en:
Sulaman is 38 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Sulaman has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which rears poultry. 

To help expand his business, Sulaman has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feeder, feeds, and will help Sulaman to generate greater profits and educate his children. Sulaman hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the supplies. 

Sulaman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy poultry feeder and feeds for his expanding poultry farm

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, and cooking oil, and will help Robert to generate greater profit. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his daily income. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, and cooking oil

loans.name: Edik

texts.en: Edik is 45 years old and he lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. Edik lives with his wife and son (who works as a mechanic). Edik is the owner of a small farm where he has bulls, and poultry. He sells beef and also a lot of poultry and eggs to his already-regular customers. On his plot of land Edik cultivates potatoes and tomatoes, which he sells wholesale to local re-sellers. As Edik says, he likes his farm and all the work connected with it greatly, and with this partnership with Kiva he hopes to provide enough fodder for all his farm cattle and for his chickens as well.

loans.use: to provide enough fodder for all his farm cattle and for his chickens as well

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en: Seryozha is 53 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. Here Seryozha lives with his mother, his son and his daughter. The only breadwinner of his family is Seryozha and he sustains all his family's needs thanks to his farm, where he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, bulls and chickens. Land cultivation also forms part of his family's income, since he cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, cabbages and greens. All these vegetables he both sells and takes for his family's use. Seryozha sells his farm’s milk, meat and eggs, with the help of his mother, to their regular customers. He will be very happy if Kiva lenders support him with this loan amount, which he will use to purchase potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land, and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: purchase potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Avag

texts.en: In Sevan city of Gegharkunik region lives Avag with his wife and two sons (his elder son is a student and his younger son is still school-aged). Avag has vocational education and specialized as a cook. For many years he worked at different hotels and restaurants as a cook. Now he does not work in his specialty, but he has his own small business; he has a cute market where he sells juices, sweets, bread, cheese, sausages, beverages and a great range of other food that people usually need every day. His market is greatly visited and very popular in his city. Avag’s wife does not work but she greatly helps her husband in their family business. Avag asks for this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, as he wants to refresh the assortment of goods in his market and also buy a lot of new products, so as to gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy a lot of new products, so as to have a various assortment of goods to gain more customers.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak started his fruits and vegetables business a few months ago. He trades in Kapan's market by bringing products from Yerevan. Artak's parents help him a lot with this business and due to their hard work income has already started to appear. By applying for this loan, Artak plans to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to sell to customers. This is very important time for Artak to boost his sales because this season people are preparing jams and different fruit cans for the winter, resulting in high demand for fruits and vegetables. 

Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this young and enthusiastic man with his newly established business.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Melika

texts.en: Melika, a 36-year-old mother of one, took over a friend's flower shop as a way of providing for her child's school expenses. Now she makes artificial flower designs for weddings and parties, hand flowers and tiaras for brides.  With the help of her fourth loan from Maya she will buy flowers, vases and accessories such as ribbons in bulk.

loans.use: to buy flowers, vases and accesories such as ribbons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Yenis Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yenis, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es una persona muy dedicada a realizar su trabajo de corte y confección como profesión,  también se dedica a la venta de dulces tradicionales en las fiestas patronales de municipios vecinos, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos.

Yenis, tiene 5 años de experiencia en corte y confección y su pareja se dedica a la venta de dulces tradicionales en las fiestas patronales cuando ella no puede; de esta manera obtienen el dinero suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar telas, hilos, botones y zíperes, porque tiene muchos encargos y necesita abastecer su dispensario de insumos, para poder cumplir sus compromisos, también otra parte del dinero será destinada para invertirla en la venta de dulces que es administrada por su esposo. 

Los sueños de Yenis son, tener un bazar, un negocio amplio de productos de cosmetología y apoyar a sus hijos en su educación.
texts.en:
Yenis, 29 years old, attended school through the ninth grade.  She is a person who is very dedicated to doing her tailoring work as a profession.  She also works selling traditional sweets in the festivals of neighboring towns.  She has a partner and 3 children.

Yenis has 5 years of experience in tailoring and her partner works selling sweets in the festivals when she can't.  In this way they obtain enough money to satisfy the needs of their family.

She needs the loan money to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and zippers because she has many orders and needs to stock up on supplies in order to fulfill her commitments.  Also, the other part of the money will be invested in the sale of sweets that is managed by her husband. 

Yenis dreams of having a store, a large cosmetic products business and supporting her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and zippers because she has many orders and needs to stock up on supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Denis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap,salt,sugar,bread,eggs,detergent,cooking oil and other items. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soap,salt,sugar,bread,eggs,detergent.cooking oil and other items and will help Denis to generate greater profits and increase profits. Denis hopes that in the future he will be able to build residential houses. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married she has 3 kids she sells cheese and milk and she needs a loan to buy food for her cattle.  Lucia is assisted by her husband but the couple need money because their animals need to be well fed.

 Lucia and her husband work very hard the family have their own house and Lucia is been working since she was a child so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy food for her cattle

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana es una mujer laboriosa de 45 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos a quienes logro sacar adelante y hoy en día son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida desde hace cinco años, es el segundo ciclo que solicita financiamiento en ADIM, para la compra de pan, chorizo, marucha, café y gaseosa.
texts.en: Dona Juana is a hard-working 45-year-old woman.  She is in a relationship and is the mother of three children who she succeeded in raising and supporting.  Today they are independent.  She has worked selling fast food for five years.  This is her second cycle of loans with ADIM and it is to buy bread, chorizo, ramen noodles, coffee and soda pop.

loans.use: to buy bread, chorizo, ramen noodles, coffee and soda pop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has mastered her hog raising business in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She has been engaging this business after her husband dies so that she can support the needs of her family. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. 

She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 20,000 will help her build a concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail beer depot, which sells beers, sodas,juice,spirits. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beers and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and increase capital. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase more beers, sodas, juices and spirits for his retail depot

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a farmer who works and lives with her family in the locality of Meson de Ixtlahuac, in the state of Guerrero. This locality has around 720 residents, and none of them have access to conventional electricity. Paz is a farmer who harvests coffee, which can only generate income once a year, so she also has some animals, which she breeds and then sells. 

Paz has a solar system to light her house, and she wants to purchase a new one to increase the electricity power generated. With the extension of the solar systems, Paz and her family will benefit from the increase of productive hours. Also, they would be able to connect electrical appliances such as a blender, which they will use to prepare fruit juices to sell them.

loans.use: to purchase a new solar system to increase power generated from her already installed system.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light his house and improve his family's life conditions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light her houses to replace the use of candles and stop inhaling smoke.

loans.name: Lambong Group

texts.en: Phoum knows that local water sources require boiling before Phoum understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phoum purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Phoum is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light her house and replace the use of candles and wood as a light source.

loans.name: Saniye

texts.en:
Saniye is living with her mother and sisters.  Eleven years ago she started selling lingerie and baby wear in a carriage in the district bazaar.  Two years after, she bought herself a car and everyday she went to the district bazaars with her mother and did her sales.  

With the help of the loans from Maya she increased the variety of her products and her sales. Now Saniye goes to the bazaars four times a week while her mother helps her in her new shop of baby wear.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Saniye hanım annesi ve kardeşleriyle beraber yaşıyor.  On bir yıl önce bu işe başlamış çamaşır ve bebe çocuk giyim işine pazar çantaları ile semt pazarlarına giderek satışlarını gerçekleştirmiş.  İki yıl sonra bir araç alarak haftanın her günü ilçe pazarlarına annesiyle beraber gitmeye başlamış.  Mayadan aldığı kredilerle ürün çeşidini ve satışlarını artırmış. Saniye hanım haftanın dört günü pazarlara gidiyor annesi de yeni açtığı bebe kıyafetleri dükkânında kalarak saniye hanıma yardımcı oluyor.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to light her house and to replace the use of candles and wood, which are bad for her family's health conditions because of smoke inhalation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to improve the light conditions of his house and to stop inhaling smoke and straining his eyesight after sunset.

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Marcelino and Juana live in a share land called El Chapulín, which is located in the municipality of Acatepec. This municipality is a highly marginalized area in the state of Guerrero. Marcelino and Juana are farmers who cultivate corn during the year and sell it in season.

Marcelino lives with his wife and children in a house without electricity, so they use candles and wood as light sources. Marcelino wants to purchase a solar energy system to light his house and to improve the living conditions of his family.

With the solar energy system, they will stop inhaling the smoke from the candles and will have light to do activities after sunset. Marcelino´s children would be able to do their homework and Marcelino will be able to de-kernel his maize after sunset. Also, Marcelino will save 150 MXN (Mexican pesos), which he currently spends every month to buy candles.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to replace the use of candles to light his house. With the solar energy system, his children would be able to do their homework after sunset.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kabala in the Kabale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, David has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which deals in ladies clothes. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help David to generate greater profits and improve well being. David hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more ladies clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a computer for her home.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a la condiciones  en que su familia vivía  tuvo  que  aprender  a trabajar  desde  muy temprano edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 5 hijos de 5, 8, 11, 16 y 18 años de edad, 3 de sus  5 hijos todavía asisten a  la escuela, la mayor ya está acompañada y su otro hijo  trabaja en la  agricultura.

Emilio, se dedica  a la  agricultura desde muy pequeño, aprendio este trabajao porque no tenia otra opción, de esta manera a logrado sacar adelante  su familia y su  hijo que  le  ayuda  al igual  que  su  compañera  de  vida.

Emilio, necesita el crédito para comprar  insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos a tiempo, porque la  primera siembra que  hizo la perdió por  la  sequía, es por eso que esta vez quiere preparar la tierra a tiempo para asegurar la producción.  

Emilio, sueña con continuar cultivando sus  terrenos y poder obtener buenas cosechas y también poder darles  el  estudio  a  sus  hijos, para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Emilio is 39 years old. He studied through second grade. Due to conditions in his family, he had to learn to work from a very early age. He lives with his partner and she has worked at household tasks since she was very young. They have 5 children who are 5, 8, 11, 16, and 18 years old. Three of their five children are still in school. The oldest lives with her partner and the other son works in agriculture.

Emilio has worked in agriculture since he was young. He learned this work because he didn’t have other options. In this way, he learned to provide for his family. His son helps him out, as does his partner.

Emilio needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs in order to plant basic grains on time, because he lost his first planting due to drought. This is why he needs to prepare the land in time, so he can assure himself of production.

Emilio dreams of continuing to farm his lands and of being able to have good harvests. He also wants to be able to provide schooling to his children, so they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in order to plant basic grains on time.

loans.name: Olga Narcisa

texts.es: Olga tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive con su madre y su hijos de 2 años en Guaranda en la comunida Pucarapamba, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca ya que se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales y quiere comprarse una vaca para poducir leche, mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener un trabajo estable y el desafio al que se enfrenta es el clima, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en: Olga,who is 22 years old, is single and lives with her mother and two children, two years old, in the community of Pucarapamba in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan to buy a cow since she works in farming and  raising animals and wants to buy a cow to produce milk and improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to have a permanent job and the challenge she must meet is the climate; in her free time she likes to weave.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá I Group

texts.es:
Nicolás (el primero del lado derecho con anteojos) es un padre de familia trabajador, honrado y muy solidario con sus vecinos porque gracias a su liderazgo su grupo ha logrado obtener sus créditos en ADICLA, pues a pesar de su avanzada edad el lucha día con día para el bienestar de su familia, él cuenta que gracias al apoyo que recibió con el crédito pudo cultivar nuevamente su maíz que ha sido su fuente de ingreso todos los años, porque con lo que logra cosechar cubre la alimentación de su familia y una parte lo vende, Nicolás solicita un nuevo préstamo debido a la gran necesidad que él tiene de poder comprar fertilizante y mantener su cultivo de maíz porque  aunque él quisiera adquirir su abono no le es posible porque no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente.
El gran sueño de Nicolás es poder  mejorar sus ingresos y dejar a sus hijos e hijas en buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolas (the first person on the right side with glasses) is the father of a family..  He is hard-working, honest and very supportive to his neighbours.  Thanks to his leadership, his group has succeeded in obtaining their loans with ADICLA.  In spite of his advanced age he fights every day for the welfare of his family.  He says that thanks to the support he has received with the loan he was able to again cultivate corn which has been the source of his income throughout the years.  With what he was able to harvest he could feed his family and also have some to sell. 

Nicolas is requesting a new loan due to the great necessity that he has to be able to buy fertilizer and maintain his corn crop.  Although he would like to purchase manure, it is not possible because he doesn't have enough cash.

Nicolas's great dream is to be able to improve his income and to leave his sons and daughters in good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the cultivation of corn

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a farmer who lives in a region called Takinta, a highly marginalized area with less than twenty residents located in the municipality of Ocosingo in Chiapas. There because of the favorable climate, coffee is grown.

Ramon lives with his wife and children in a house without basic services such as electricity. He is a farmer who cultivates not only coffee but also corn on a seasonal basis.

Because the family must use candles and wood as a source of light, Ramon wants to purchase a solar-powered lighting system. He has applied for a 3,190 MXN loan through Kiva's field partner ERES Energía Renovable to buy one. With it the family will be able to see at night, the children will be able to do their homework after sunset, and the family will have light for other activities such as cooking.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered lighting system

loans.name: Rosa Gavina

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, vive junto a su pareja y sus pequeños dos hijos en la localidad rural de Cuchubambaya perteneciente a la cuidad de Moquegua. Ella se dedica a la agricultura orgánica desde hace mucho tiempo, actualmente solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de orégano. Rosa siempre le ha dado a su familia lo mejor, es por ello que se dedica a la agricultura orgánica, ella espera que en la cosecha de su cultivo pueda venderlo a un buen precio. Su mayor deseo de Rosa es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Rosa is an enterprising woman. She lives together with her partner and her two small children in the rural location of Cuchubambaya which belongs to the city of Moquegua. She has worked in organic farming for a long time. She is currently requesting a micro loan to be able to buy organic oregano seed. Rosa has always provided her family with the best, for this reason she is dedicated to organic farming. She hopes that she can sell her crop at a good price at harvest time. Rosa's greatest desire is for her children to receive a good education and can live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy organic oregano seed.

loans.name: Nancy Valeska

texts.es: Nancy es una joven emprendedora y laboriosa, tiene la edad de 20 años, es acompañada y madre de un niño. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de acero desde hace tres años y solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, Uno de sus proyectos es aumentar las ventas con la oferta de más productos, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pulseras, relojes, aretes y cadenas, con las ganancias del crédito anterior compró una vitrina donde exhibe y guarda las prendas.
texts.en: Nancy is a hard-working young entrepreneur. She is 20 years old, is in a relationship and is the mother of one child. She has worked selling steel jewellery for three years. She is requesting her third loan from ADIM. One of her projects is to increase her sales by offering more products. So she is requesting the loan to buy bracelets, watches, earrings and chains. She bought a display case with the profits from the last loan where she can keep and exhibit her jewellery.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, watches, earrings and chains.

loans.name: Erika Yessenia

texts.es:
Erika, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja es albañil, tiene  3 hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años de edad y solo los dos mayores asisten a la  escuela de  su comunidad.

Erika, se  dedica  a la venta de   ropa desde hace 7 años, decidió  iniciarlo ya  que  su madre y  su  hermano también lo realizan y les genera buenas ganancias; ella sale  a vender sus productos en el centro de la  ciudad  y los lugares  aledaños y no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo.

Erika, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para su negocio, porque actualmente tiene proveedores que le  venden la mercancía a buen precio y es por eso que quiere aprovechar la oportunidad.

Erika, sueña con hacer  crecer  su negocio y en un futuro  tener  un local para exhibir su mercadería  y que  sus  hijos  puedan  estudiar.
texts.en:
Erika, 32 years old, studied through third grade.  She is married; her partner is a mason.  Erika has three children, who are 4, 6  and 10 years old.  Only the two older ones go school in her community.

Erika has been earning a living selling clothing for the past 7 years.  She decided to begin this business since her mother and brother also were doing this and getting good profits.  She goes to the downtown city to sell her products and to areas nearby, and does not have fixed hours of work.

Erika needs the loan to buy more clothing for her business, since at present she has providers who sell her merchandise at a good price and thus she wants to take advantage of the opportunity.  She dreams of making her business grow and in the future having a store to display her merchandise, and that her children will be able to be students.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her sales business

loans.name: Pedro's Group

texts.en:
Pedro and Felix are two farmers who cultivate corn, beans and sugar cane. Both of them live in Takinta, which is located in the municipality of Ocosingo in Chiapas. This is a highly marginalized area in which residents earn around 3 USD per day.

Pedro and Felix live with their families in houses with no access to basic services such as electricity, so they burn wood as a light source. They and their families are constantly inhaling wood smoke, which is bad for their health.

Pedro and Felix want to buy solar-powered lighting systems for their houses, so Pedro is applying for a 6,757 MXN loan through Kiva's field partner ERES Energía Renovable. Purchase of these solar-powered lights will give the families productive hours after sunset, including light by which their children can study and do their homework.

loans.use: to purchase solar systems to light their houses

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one child. He has his own small business.

He sells men's clothes, mostly suits. He has good quality clothes and affordable  prices. Sergei is always friendly and polite with his clients. 

Sergei is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase the assortments of suits and pants. He hopes to get a bigger income during this summer.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of suits and pants

loans.name: Mykhailo

texts.en:
Mykhailo is married and has two small children.  He sells meat at the market. Mykhailo is a very hardworking person. He wants to do the best for his family. 

He is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAН to install a new roof. He wants to change the old wooden construction to metal to ensure the absence of leaks and make the house look better outside.

loans.use: to install a new roof and get rid of leaks

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina  is 67 years old and she is still being a farmer. She sells many kinds of vegetables and she needs another loan to purchase improved seeds.

She has been in this business since she was a child. She learned with her parents. Right now she doesn't have anyone who can help her so she hopes you can do it again. Valentina is healthy and she works hard.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of improved seeds.

loans.name: Aureliano's Group

texts.en:
Aureliano and Adolfo are brothers who live in Takinta, a highly marginalized area with less than twenty residents located in Ocosingo in the state of Chiapas. They cultivate corn; additionally, the brothers saved up enough money together to buy four cows to make cheese and milk to sell.

Aureliano and Adolfo live with their wives and children in houses with no electricity, so they burn wood for light. They want to buy solar-powered lighting systems with a 6,674 MXN loan obtained through Kiva's field partner ERES Energia Renovable. Using the lights will replace the use of wood and improve living conditions for the families. Their children will be able to study and do their homework after sunset.

loans.use: to buy solar systems to light his and his brother's houses

loans.name: Andres Reyes

texts.es: Andrés de 58 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 26, 20 y 16 años de edad de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan y el menor se dedica a estudiar.  Andrés posee una venta de granos básicos en un puesto a  la orilla de una carretera cercana a su comunidad y gracias a su producto de calidad tiene muchos clientes con los cuales sabe que tiene una venta segura. Anteriormente Andrés obtuvo un crédito el cual utilizo para mejoras de su vivienda y debido a la buena experiencia solicita un nuevo crédito  a través  de FUSAI con cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de  producto al por mayor tales como: frijol y arroz para aumentar  las ventas de su negocio y de esta manera tener más que ofrecerle a sus clientes y a la vez mejorar sus ingresos económicos que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés is 58 years old. He lives in his own house along with his sons who are 26, 20, and 16 years old. The two oldest work and the youngest one is studying. Andrés has a stand where he sells basic grains on the side of the road, near his community. Thanks to his quality products, he has many customers and is assured of his sales. 

Andrés previously obtained a loan that he used to improve his house. Due to that good experience, he is requesting a new loan through FUSAI, with which he will be able to buy a larger quantity of his products at wholesale, such as beans and rice to increase his sales. In this way, he’ll have more to offer to his customers and at the same time he’ll improve his income, which will allow him to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of his products at wholesale, such as beans and rice to increase his sales.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old. She is the mother of two daughters and she is living with her parents. She loves them very much and helps them with the expenses at the house. 

Jacqueline needs another loan to make a payment to the university where her daughter studies. That is something very important for her so she hopes you can help her again. Jacqueline is still working as a secretary.

loans.use: to make a payment to the university where her daughter studies.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en: Pascuala is 34 years old. She has two sons and is living with her parents. Pascuala is a farmer. She is selling vegetables and she distributes them every Saturday at many markets and fairs. Pascuala needs another loan to buy modified seeds for her business. She is working hard. She is healthy and she is ready to work even harder. She works every day without rest.

loans.use: to buy modified seeds.

loans.name: Romer

texts.en: Romer is single and he is living with his parents. Romer is a carpenter and he works with metals too. Romer needs a loan to buy wood because he has a very big business and he needs materials. Romer is the person who supports his parents.  He works hard, he is very skillful and he hopes you can help him.  Romer would like to have a better workshop in the future. As you can see in the picture, the place doesn't have a roof, so it is very exhausting to work there.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to light her house, improve her family's health, and save money for light source each month.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Vicent has been working hard to manage his charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Vicent has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal, and will help Vicent to generate greater profits and increase income. Vicent hopes that in the future he will be able to have self sustainability. 

Vicent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vicent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal to generate income and profit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to light their houses and stop using candles and wood as light sources

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Ambrose has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap,salt,sugar,bread,eggs,detergent.cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Ambrose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soap,salt,sugar,bread,eggs,detergent.cooking oil, and will help Ambrose to generate greater profits and construct a house. Ambrose hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a motor cycle. 

Ambrose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ambrose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, cooking oil

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is still working as an accountant for a private company and now she is interested to be part of the bread business. She will make bread in her free time in that way she will be able to make more money  So Janeth needs a loan to buy supplies such as salt and flour.

Janeth hopes you can help her.  She will be assisted by her husband and she thinks she will make an excellent product

loans.use: to buy supplies such as salt and flour for her new bakery

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is married. She is 50 years old and she is still a farmer. She sells vegetables and she distributes them every Saturday. She is assisted by her family but right now her husband is on a business trip. Julia needs a loan to purchase improved seeds and manure for her business. She hopes you can help her. She works hard and is responsible. She is supported by her family and she knows what to do because she has been a farmer since she was a child.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his hardware business, which deals in hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items and will help Francis to generate greater profits and expand business. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to open another outlet. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more hardware items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 54 years old and married with five children.

Matilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Matilde has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Matilde aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Alexandra Paola

texts.es: Alexandra de 27 años, reside junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla.  En su restaurante cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en compañía de su suegra y todos los días a partir de las 10 a.m. estas comprometidas mujeres están disponibles para ofrecer el mejor servicio a un precio de oportunidad; ellas han fortalecido su negocio con una promesa de calidad y exquisitez, por eso su producto líder son los almuerzos corrientes que consisten en escoger una proteína como carne, pollo o pescado, que se sirve acompañado de arroz, legumbres, ensaladas, sopas y refrescos.  Cada vez son más los clientes que desean probar de estos platos y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en compra de materias primas y así mismo capitalizarse.  Como su meta a futuro es asegurar el futuro de sus dos hijos, Alexandra continuará trabajando con el excelente desempeño que ha tenido y ofreciendo todo el amor a sus comidas.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and their two dependent children in a neighborhood to the south of Barranquilla. She has had five years of experience with her restaurant, with the help of her mother-in-law. 

Every day, starting at 10:00 am, these hardworking ladies start work, offering the best service at a good price. They have strengthened the business with a promise of exquisite quality. Their leading items are lunches that consist of choosing a protein, such as beef, chicken, or fish, which is served with rice, vegetables, a salad, soup, and a soft drink. 

Every day there are more customers who want to try these meals, and this is why she is applying for a loan. This is the first loan she has taken with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will invest it in the purchase of ingredients. 

Her goal for the future is to assure the future for her two children. Alexandra will continue with the excellent work she always has and continue offering all of her love to her foods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada De Tupac Amaru Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernarda ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru ["Purified Virgin of Tupac Amaru"] communal bank. This bank is located in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Mrs. Bernarda is married, is 58 years old and has 4 children. She works in her business, a grocery store. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8am until 7pm. She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She requests the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members make a living selling handicrafts, selling clothes, in the grocery store business, and selling animals.

Mrs. Bernarda is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means and she pledges to make her payments according to the established time-frame.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Mamacha Asunta De Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA DE COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erminia ella es soltera y tiene 58 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Mamacha Asunta de Coya” communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Coya, in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

Erminia is single and she is 58 years old. She has a small grocery store business and a restaurant. She sells items of basic need, such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She wants to get ahead with this business. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person. Her dream is to grow the grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

The other members have businesses selling sweets, selling clothing, grocery stores, and a restaurant. 

Erminia is thankful to those who are a part of this dream though this organization and she pledges to make her repayments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

loans.name: Ave Maria

texts.en:
Ave Maria is 52 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Ave Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Ave Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ave Maria has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future Ave Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Idania

texts.en: Woof Woof Wouse is a dog care facility owned by Idania.  Woof Woof Wouse provides a complete set of services including a full service pet hotel with grooming, training, daycare service, and dog walking. Unlike Idania's nearby competitor, Woof Woof Wouse does not cage the dogs left in its care. Instead, her client's dogs are allowed to roam free around the property and are treated with the utmost care and compassion. Idania's customers often become repeat customers due to her dedication to providing the best service. This loan will help Idania reach a larger target market and will support her company's unique business model.

loans.use: to grow her client base and provide competitive service.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Diana works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Diana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use for dressmaking in her tailoring business.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use for dressmaking.

loans.name: Nusuru

texts.en:
Nasuru is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 7 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Nasuru has been working hard to manage his produce business, which deals in selling produce. 

To help expand his business, Nasuru has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce and will help Nasuru to generate greater profits and increase profits. Nasuru hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more business outlets. 

Nasuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nasuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more farm supplies produce for sale

loans.name: Ma. Rosalie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalie is 44 years old and married with three children. With all children in school, Ma. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Rosalie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to resell.

Ma. Rosalie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to resell.

loans.name: Noe

texts.en: El Sembrador Landscaping is a landscape design company, specializing in garden maintenance and green areas. They are known for their outstanding and professional service. A few months ago, Noe's old equipment became unusable to the extent that it would be cheaper to buy new machines than repair the old ones. Noe's business loan applications were declined from banks and not having the money to buy new equipment, Noe has not been able to serve all of his clients. This loan will help fund a new lawnmower and that equipment will enable him to generate more revenue for his business and continue serving new clients.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his landscaping business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 59 years old and married with three children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Grace has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en: Palenque Deli and Grocery LLC is a restaurant that serves much sought after Latin food to its customers. Known for its high quality of customer service and the unique flavor of its food, Palenque Deli is a beloved restaurant in its community. Oralia will use this loan to further her restaurant's customer base and market her restaurant to a larger target demographic. The loan will support the growth and sustainability of Oralia's restaurant. While the restaurant itself is less than a year old, Oralia has already established a niche for it, and hopes to watch it grow.

loans.use: to extend her customer base.

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
Lowella works hard to support her family. Lowella is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Lowella requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lowella has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future Lowella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is single and she makes cheese.  She needs a loan to buy cattle to produce more milk, so she hopes you can help her . She learned about her business when she was a child. She doesnt have children but she helps her parents and she lives with them.

 Right now the mother is unemployed so Wilma has to take care of many financial responsibilities, Wilma is healthy and she is ready to work harder

loans.use: to buy cattle for milk production and her cheese manufacturing

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 59 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, sugar, noodles, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Dominga has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, sugar, noodles, coffee, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk and coffee

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз, 31 год, замужем, есть 2 детей, образование- среднее. Уже 3 года она ведет свое хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду Дилафруз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, на участке мерою 0,56 Га она выращивает картофель, лук, морковь. Также продает лепешки (национальный хлеб) и булочки, пекут лупешки сами - в тандыре. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дилафруз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного тандыра и муки. В бизнесе помоет супруг и дети.  Доходы от бизнеса Дилафруз планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a secondary school education. Dilafruz has run her own farm for 3 years. Thanks to her very hard work, she now has a cow on her farm, and she raises potatoes, onions, and carrots on a plot of land measuring 0.56 hectares. In addition, Dilafruz sells lepeshki (a traditional bread) and rolls. She bakes the lepeshki herself in a tandoor oven. Dilafruz's monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, Dilafruz has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy an additional tandoor oven and flour. Her husband and children help her with her business. Dilafruz plans to use the profits from her business to continue developing her business, and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a tandoor oven and flour for the production and sale of traditional pastries.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his clothing, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes business, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and financial increment. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to become the best supplier. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for his store and support his family

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Merly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Merly has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from personal products.

Merly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana es una mujer laboriosa de 46 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un hijo, quien es su mayor deseo de superación, ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace diez años y solicita por quinta vez el financiamiento en ADIM, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, maíz, pollo, cerdo, papa y legumbres.
texts.en: Ana, 46, is a hard-working woman with a domestic partner and a child, whose success is her biggest desire. She has made her living selling nactamales, steamed plantain leaves wrapped around various fillings, for ten years. This is the fifth time soliciting ADIM, whose goals include building up and improving businesses. This loan will be used to buy rice, corn, chicken, pork, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, chicken, pork, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Geysel Margarita

texts.es: Geysel es una mujer laboriosa de 28 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de buñuelos desde hace dos años, mientras ella prepara la mezcla de los buñuelos y la mamá le ayuda a freírlos, una de sus metas es vender en más cantidades, por esta razón solicita el crédito para la compra de yuca, azúcar, aceite, queso, aceite, leña y bolsas. Con las ganancias del crédito anterior logro remodelar su cocinero y comprar pailas para freír.
texts.en:
GEYSEL is a hardworking woman of 28 years of age.  She lives common-law and is a mother of four children who are her greatest motivation.

She has been selling doughnuts for the past two years.  She prepares the doughnuts and her mom helps with frying them.  

One of her goals is to sell in larger quantities. She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase cassava, sugar, oil, cheese, oil, wood and bags. With the profits of the previous loan she was able to remodel the cooking area and purchase frying pans.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, sugar, oil, cheese, oil, wood and bags.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aurora has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business.

Aurora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Aurora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct selling of herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

Jennie has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Jennie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 4 años de edad, su pareja es empleado y trabaja como promotor de salud.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de joyas enchapadas y también trabaja en un cafetín de la escuela, de esta manera apoya a su pareja con los gastos de la casa, ya que próximamente tendrán más gastos porque ella está esperando otro bebe dentro de 3 meses.

El préstamo será para comprar más joyas enchapadas, para abastecerse de más producto y vender más mientras pueda salir a vender, porque cuando tenga a su bebe ya no lo podrá hacer. 

Rosa, sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, is a very hardworking and determined woman. She has a domestic partner and two daughters, who are 6 and 4 years old. Her partner is employed and works as a health promoter. 

Rosa makes her living selling gold-plated jewels and also works in the school café. This way, she helps out her partner with the household needs, especially because soon they will have more needs, since Rosa is expecting another baby in three months.

The loan will be used to buy more gold-plated gems, to stock up on more products, and to sell more until she stops working, because when she has the baby, she will not be able to work. 

Rosa's dream is to expand her work and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more gold-plated gems.

loans.name: Julia Francisca

texts.es: Julia es una señora trabajadora de 59 años de edad, madre soltera de cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace tres años, una de sus hijas le ayuda en el negocio cocinando, solicita por treceavo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, cabe destacar que ella ha mostrado ser una mujer responsable y puntual con los pagos, con las ganancias de los créditos anteriores logro mejorar su vivienda. Ahora uno de sus proyectos es poner una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de tortilla, arroz, carne, legumbres, aceite y leña.
texts.en: Julia, 59, is a hardworking woman. She is a single mother of four children who has made her living selling food for the last three years. One of her daughters helps her cook for her business. This is her thirteenth time soliciting ADIM, which demonstrates that she has shown to be a responsible woman who is punctual with payments.With the profits of previous loans, she was able to improve her house. Now, one of her projects is to put a small grocery store in her home. This loan will be used towards tortilla, rice, meat, vegetables, oil, and firewood.

loans.use: to buy tortilla, rice, meat, vegetables, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá Iii Group

texts.es:
Juan (es el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía) es un hombre de grandes aspiración y con apoyo del crédito el espera seguir prosperando, pues él se encuentra  muy satisfecho porque afortunadamente las inversiones que realizado en su cultivo de maíz le ha salido muy bien es por ello que el junto a su grupo agradece ese apoyo,  él cuenta que la cosecha producido muy buenas mazorcas por lo que sus familias cuenta con suficiente alimento para este años, pero debido a la necesidad que ellos tiene año con año para poder cultivar solicitan un nuevo  préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y dale mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz para la cosecha de este año.
Juan tiene el anhelo se conseguir este nuevo crédito para seguir prosperando y   comprar más terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan (the first on the right side of the picture) is a man of great ambitions.  With the support from a loan he hopes to continue to prosper.  

He is very satisfied because, fortunately, the investments made into his corn crop has turned out very well.  That is why, along with his group, he appreciates the support. 

He notes that the harvest produced good ears of corn so that his family has enough food for this year, but because of the need they have every year to cultivate, they request a new loan to purchase fertilizer and give maintenance to their corn crop and harvest for this year.

Juan hopes to get a new loan so as to continue to prosper and be able to purchase more land for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn cultivation.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 51 years old, married, and lives at Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and starts growing vegetables and bananas. 

With a desire to earn more, she decided to grow bananas as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase bags of fertilizers and labor cost for land preparation. Now, she requests a loan of 14,000 PHP. 

She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to buy additional land for her vegetable and banana growing business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and labor cost for land preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Allem

texts.en:
Allem is 46 years old and married she works very hard to help her husband.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Allem has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Allem would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is 25 years old, married, and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a farmer on her place. 

She manages her garden together with her husband and earns a meager amount to sustain other family needs. She ask for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers for her gardening business. She hopes that she can produce more so that she can supply vegetables to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers for her gardening business

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is 67 years old and a widow from Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. 

She landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her husband died. PMPC came as a rescue to Procesa, lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount of PHP 14,900 for fertilizers and a knapsack sprayer for her gardening business. Procesa perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and a knapsack sprayer for her gardening business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase cloth, buttons, zippers, thread, and other materials used for dressmaking for her tailoring business.

Janette has been in this business for two years. Janette earns more income from fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, buttons, zippers, thread, and other materials used for dress making

loans.name: Marea Alta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (ANGELA, SINNE MARIA,  y LOYDA) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 3 años para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

LOYDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Marea Alta, es una señora jovial de 34 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada con 3 hijos que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como pescador artesanal. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, pollo, productos lácteos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (ANGELA, SINNE MARIA, and LOYDA) of the Miskito of the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. 

They are entrepreneurial women who work every day with the determination to achieve growth of their small businesses. They organized themselves as a solidarity group about 3 years ago to obtain a loan from Pana Pana.

LOYDA: The coordinator of the solidarity group Marea Alta, is a jovial lady of 34 years of age.  She has leadership qualities, is married and has 3 children studying in secondary school.  Her husband works informally as a fisherman. 

In order to have her own source of income and contribute to household expenses and to the education of her children, she established a small grocery store two years ago.

She is requesting a loan to purchase:  basic grains, Snacks, chicken, dairy products, among other products. 

She dreams of being a successful merchant.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, chicken, dairy products, among other products.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth
