texts.es: Diana es madre soltera, esta en los 28 años de edad, sus 2 hijas tienen 3 y 5 años de edad, Diana lucha sola por sus hijas y comenta que la mayor ya asiste a la escuela, Diana se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo solicita para invertirle en la compra de chanchos, el sueño de Diana es el invertir su crédito para pagarlo de las ganancias que obtenga  de su negocio y también para pagar los gastos que tiene de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old and is a single mother. Her two daughters are three and five years old. Diana fights alone for her daughters and says that her oldest already attends school. 

Diana raises small animals. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying pigs. Diana's dream is to invest her loan so that she can repay it from her earnings and also to pay for her daughters' expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Flor Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es una joven que vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos  de 1, 5, 10 y 11 años de edad, Maribel nació y reside en el campo donde a lo que se puede se dedicar es a la crianza de animales y al jornal de actividades de agricultura, el esposo de  Maribel es jornalero y agricultor, Maribel solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, Maribel es buena madre y comenta que todo su esfuerzo lo hace para el bienestar de sus hijos y espera mejorar su negocio para  a futuro comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young woman that lives with her husband and four children ages one, five, ten and eleven years old. Maribel was born and lives in the countryside where she can work in animal husbandry and agricultural activities. Maribel's husband is a day laborer and farmer. 

Maribel is requesting this loan to invest in buying pigs. Maribel is a good mother and says that all of her hard work is for her children's welfare. She hopes to improve her business so that she can buy her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá Ii Group

texts.es:
Diego (el tercero del lado izquierdo de playera blanca con pants rojo) es un hombre de campo que se esmera mucho para darle a su familia lo mejor él tiene 32 años de edad y vive junto a su amada familia, diego se encuentra muy satisfecho por el crédito al que tuvo la dicha de poder acceder pues con este apoyo él pudo cultivar su maíz y su familia contó un año más con alimentos suficiente, Diego y su grupo debido a las carencias que padecen en su comunidad solicitan un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar fertilizantes y darle el mantenimiento a su  cosecha de maíz para este año.
El anhelo de Diego es construir una casa más grande para ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Diego (third from the left and and wearing a white shirt with red pants) is a farmer who works hard to give his family the best. He is 32 years old and lives with his loving family. 

Diego is very pleased with the loan he had the good fortune to receive. With this support he was able to grow his corn and his family had enough food for a year. 

Because of the poverty in their community, Diego and his group are requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers and maintain their corn crop for this year. Diego's dream is to build a larger home so that he can offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Jose Idalio

texts.es: Jose de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 25 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. para poder tener un buen cultivo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old and lives in his own home along with his three children. He has been cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum for 25 years. Jose sells his products at different markets that are near his house.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can have a good crop and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 22 años es soltera tiene un hijo vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la Comunida Pucarapamba ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales hace algumos años, ella solicita el credito para comprar fertilizantes para la siembra de papas y la compra de una vaca pequeña, gracia al crédito podra mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es comprarse una casa para ya no arrendar, el desafio al que se enfrenta es las enfermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta caminar con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 22 years old, single, and has one child. She lives in the community of Pucarapamba in Guaranda, which is located in Bolivar Province. Ana has been devoted to agriculture and raising animals for a few years.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers for planting potatoes and also to purchase a small cow. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her quality of life. Her dream is to buy a house so that she no longer has to rent. The challenge she faces is dealing with crop diseases.

In her free time, she enjoys going for walks with her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a small cow.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia has always enjoyed farming. She has cultivated her corn field in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur and has made good profit through this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to purchase additional corn seeds and bags of fertilizers. Letecia knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Letecia hopes to buy a neighboring corn field in order to increase corn production.

loans.use: to purchase additional corn seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 35 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Lalaine has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries like rice, canned good, personal care products and other groceries.

Lalaine has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in gardening and she also earns income for her family through it. 

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Janice wishes to become the supplier of flowers for the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta City. She is 64 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Fely has joined the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. 

Fely hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 64 years old, married, and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Lilia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She keeps her membership in good standing with no record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Lilia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the ardent passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Edzel

texts.en:
Edzel is a married, 42-year-old woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Edzel owns a general store in the Philippines. Edzel has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, rice and feed to sell.

In the future, Edzel would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 54 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell. Edna has been in this business for 6 years.

Edna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, noodles, etc.

Gina has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, and noodles

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en:
Jayjay is 41 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are attending school.

Jayjay is in the aquaculture business, running an oyster farm in the Philippines. Jayjay requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

Jayjay has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jayjay would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 34 years old and has six children. Haide is married and five of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. Haide requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Haide has been farming bananas for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Haide would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ruaina

texts.en:
Ruaina is 33 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruaina runs a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell. Ruaina has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Ruaina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nalina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Nalina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair for her fishing business.

Nalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Shiela is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Marivic has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Victoria is 42 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Victoria has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tura

texts.en:
Tura is 39 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like cream, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, etc.

Tura has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like cream, coffee, eggs, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fishnets and materials for a boat repair.

Annie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new fishnets and materials for a boat repair

loans.name: Erney Antonio

texts.es: Erney de 18 años, reside en compañía de sus padres en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla. En la actualidad se encuentra cursando estudios universitarios y su meta a futuro es graduarse como profesional y poder ayudar económicamente a su familia.  Su idea de negocio surgió gracias a su madre quien vende mercancías varias y le propuso que le ofreciera a sus compañeros de clase en la universidad, fue todo un éxito, se interesaron en adquirir perfumes, lociones corporales y shampoo.  Así mismo poco a poco su clientela se incrementó y con ello su oferta de productos, es por ello que adicionó prendas de vestir y calzado juvenil. Como su capital es insuficiente para poder atender a todos los pedidos de sus compañeros, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en perfumes y colonias, prendas de vestir como suéteres, camisetas y jean. Esta inversión le permitirá vender más y responder oportunamente a sus encargos. Gracias a esta solicitud de crédito considera que podrá acercarse a la meta de capitalizarse para ampliar su cobertura de clientes.
texts.en:
Erney is 18 year old, lives with his parents in a neighborhood south of Barranquilla. At present he is attending university and his goal for the future is to graduate as a professional and to be able to help his family financially.

His business idea emerged thanks to his mother who sells various goods and suggested that he offer them to various classmates at university. It was a success. They were interested in purchasing perfumes, body lotions and shampoo. Also, little by little, his customers increased and with them his product offerings, which is why he added youth clothing and footwear.

As his capital is insufficient to be able to serve all requests of his classmates, he has applied for a CrediKiva ["Kiva loan"], first financing done through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ["Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo"], which he will invest in perfumes and colognes, and clothing such as sweaters, shirts and jeans.

This investment will allow him to sell more and to respond quickly to his demand. Thanks for considering this loan request. He will be able to near his capitalization goal for the purpose of expanding his customer base.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes and colognes, and clothing such as sweaters, shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 58 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Crispina has borrowed and paid 40 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 49 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Jelita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Jelita has been pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and is married. Caridad owns and operates a small sari-sari (variety) store at her place. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2005, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be her 20th loan from PMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and have working capital

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en: Edelita is a businesswoman in Tudela. She is 38 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Edelita runs a small sari-sari store at her place. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. Edelita believes having enough inventory will allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rean

texts.en:
Rean is 30 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rean has a general store business in the Philippines. Rean requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Rean has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anita is 50 years old and one of her children is in school.

Anita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, no pudo seguir en la escuela porque la zona en la que aún vive, fue altamente azotada por la guerra civil en El Salvador, está soltera, pero tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos trabaja y el otro está estudiando primer año en la universidad, solo vive con uno de sus hijos.

Antonia, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos para la alimentación diaria de ella y de su hijo; ella tiene el deseo de dedicarse a la crianza de ganado, ya que dispone de una pequeña propiedad que puede servirle, para la crianza.- 

Antonia, está solicitando un crédito para comprar semilla, fertilizantes y otros insumos necesarios porque  tiene plantación de frutas y quiere invertir más para diversificar su finca, pero no dispone del dinero suficiente para empezar a financiar sus sueños. 

Antonia, sueña con ver a su hijo graduado de la universidad, además quiere ir poco a poco diversificando su finca, sembrando más arboles y cuidando el medio ambiente para heredar a sus hijos un futuro prometedor y no degradado.
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and has a seventh-grade education. She could not continue at school any further as the area, where she still lives, was seriously affected by the civil war in El Salvador. Antonia is single but has two children, one of whom works, the other of whom is in first year at university. Antonia lives with just one of her sons.

Antonia works growing basic grains in order to feed herself and her son. Antonia wants to raise cattle, as she has a small property that would serve for this purpose.

Antonia is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers and other necessary supplies. Antonia grows fruits and wants to invest more in order to diversify her farm, but does not have the capital to finance her dreams.

Antonia dreams of seeing her son graduate from university. Gradually, she would also like to diversify her farm, planting more trees and looking after the environment to leave her children a promising future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers and other supplies necessary for diversifying her farm.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting as well as earning income. Margarita has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Margarita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides to have plants that are healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding. Someday, Margarita hopes to purchase another piece of land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 37 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband as the fisherman for five years already and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to pay for boat repair and maintenance. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand their fishing business.

loans.use: to pay for boat repair and maintenance

loans.name: Adonna

texts.en:
Adonna is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children go to school.

Adonna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Adonna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Adonna would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase nail polish, cotton, cuticle remover and other nail cleaning equipment for her manicure and pedicure service business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, cotton, cuticle remover and other nail cleaning equipment

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned that she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Gloria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase additional heads of piglets for her fattening business. Gloria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of piglets for fattening

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Mercy has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol de 22 años es una joven microempresaria con un gran carisma para las ventas, lo que le permitió crecer en su negocio; inicialmente vendía productos de uso personal a sus amigos y conocidos, pero su habilidad para los negocios la condujo a buscar nuevos horizontes.  Ella consideró que podría comprar unas vitrinas y aperturar una miscelánea, de este modo surtiría su negocio con nuevos artículos que anteriormente no comercializaba, lo que le permitiría ampliar su gama de productos.   Su éxito no se hizo esperar, diariamente llegan sus clientes solicitando todo tipo de artículos; cremalleras, botones, papelería, ropa infantil, productos de aseo personal y todo lo relacionado con detalles para toda ocasión. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con nuevos modelos de ropa y mercancías varias.  Marisol ha demostrado que pese a su escaso capital y una competencia arrolladora, se puede lograr lo que se quiere, si amas lo que haces.  Su meta a futuro es continuar en su negocio con mucho mas surtido para así ampliarlo y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is 22 years old and a young, small-time entrepreneur with a flare for sales that has allowed her to expand her business. 

Marisol began by selling personal products to friends and acquaintances, but her skill for business brought her to look for new opportunities. Marisol decided that she could buy display cases and open a miscellany, stocking it up with products that she did not previously sell. This would allow her to expand her range of products.

Marisol did not have to wait for success, with customers coming in every day looking for all types of products: zips, buttons, stationery, children's clothing, personal hygiene products, and decorations for all occasions.

Marisol is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to stock up her shop with new clothing ranges and merchandise.

Marisol has shown that, even with very little capital and a lot of competition, you can do what you want if you love what you do.

Marisol's goal for the future is to continue with her business with more stock, and to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing ranges and other merchandise.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly has always dreamed of having more fishing boats to boost her income so that she can support her children. She used her loan to purchase materials for another fishing boat. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase materials for another fishing boat

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Retailing helps Brigida's family survive. She retails merchandise and brings in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She finds the business of retailing basic goods easy and simple. Brigida plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase canned goods, detergent bars, beauty soaps and condiments for retail. Brigida smiles at the idea of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like canned goods, detergent bars, beauty soap and condiments

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has mastered her hog raising business in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, she does the same with her membership in PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run to them for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 3,000 will help her purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of crabs and shrimp business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional crabs and shrimp to sell.

Rodelia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Febeth

texts.en: Febeth is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 27 years old, married, and has a meat shop in Tangub City. This is how she supports her family, with a meager income of 8,000 PHP per month. Recently, Febeth took out a loan to purchase Nipa thatch roofing, wood, nails, and sticks for house repair. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch, wood, nails, and sticks for house repair

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 77 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalia has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a  25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of tobacco to offer for sale.

Rosalia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of tobacco to offer for sale.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
Eustaquia es una mujer de 57 años de edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que se encuentra a 20 kilómetros al este de la ciudad, es conocida por la diversidad de comida típica y por su fiesta patronal donde los creyentes van a pie. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Eustaquia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (al centro, viste blusa beige, suéter azul y pollera). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus familiares que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller mecánico, cerrajería, tejido de ropa de bebé, artesanía en cerámica y venta de productos naturales, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros, “la comida se vende a diario y el clima del lugar hace que los alimentos se malogren rápidamente es por eso que necesito una heladera…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una heladera donde refrigerar los alimentos. Su sueño es ampliar su puesto de comida, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera dónde conservar los alimentos frescos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eustaquia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para aumentar la oferta y vender más comida
texts.en:
Eustaquia is a 57-year-old woman who is a widow, has 4 independent children, and sells food for a living.  She's an entrepreneur, patient, listens well, is supportive, resilient, responsible and very hardworking.  She runs her business in the town of Cotoca which is located 20 kilometers to the east of the city.  It's known for a variety of traditional food as well as its patronage festival where believers go around on foot.  It has a hot subtropical climate with a temperature that varies from 21-35 degrees Celsius during the day.  

Eustaquia has a brown complexion, brown eyes, long, black hair which she keeps in a braid, is of short stature, has a robust physique, and speaks Guarani as her native language.  She speaks Spanish due to the general culture as well as needing it to run her business.  She's in the center of the picture, and is wearing a beige blouse with a blue sweater and a skirt.  

She enjoys her life in the company of her family members who work.  They live in a room of their own made with bricks and cement, a roof of corrugated iron and a cement floor, with potable water, electricity and access to a sewer system.  The need to increase their income has led them to form a group of people with businesses such as a mechanic's garage, a locksmith's shop, knitting clothing for babies, making ceramic handicrafts and selling natural products, all in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.  Her business is selling food such as majao (ground jerky, boiled bananas and rice), peanut soup (soup with a peanut base), stuffed locotos (locoto peppers, meat with spices, onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), ají de panza (tripe, onions, and tomatoes accompanied with rice), and others.  "The food is sold every day, and the climate in the area makes the food spoil quicker," she says.  "That's why I need a refrigerator."

The advantage of her business is that the food is sold constantly.  The disadvantage is that she lacks the money to buy a refrigerator to keep her food cold.  Her dream is to expand the place she sells her food from.  She wants to invest in her business by buying a refrigerator where she can keep her fresh food.  This is the 1st sequence of loans with the institution in 10 years that's developing this business.  These are the reasons why Eustaquia is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator, expand her offering and sell more food.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator to expand her offering and sell more food

loans.name: Bataillon 1 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Alex est  le coordonateur de son groupe Bataillon 1 & 3. Il n'est pas marie et il a  2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de L'éau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de produits divers pendant  les 5 dernieres années. Avant de  commencer ce commerce il était  cultivateur.
 
Alex espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Il a payé son bien et ceci est votre prêt de 2 avec Esperanza internacional. Il va acheté de chaussures, cosmétiques, vêtements, etc.

Des autres membres de Bataillon 1 & 3 ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, poisson, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, charbon, vetements, et produit divers. Il  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a voyager dans les autres pays de L’Amerique tel que Panama perou et Mexique.
texts.en:
Alex is the coordinator of the Batalion 1 & 3 group. He is not married and has two children. He lives in the northern region of Haïti where electricity is rare and access to potable water very limited. He has been running his business selling various products for the past 5 years. Before starting this business, he was a farmer. Alex hopes that this loan will help him to grow his business. He has repaid his previous loan and this is his second loan from Esperanza Internacional. He is going to buy items like shoes, cosmetics, and clothing.

The other members of the Batalion 1 & 3 group need a loan for their businesses selling, for example, cosmetics, fish, fizzy drink, food products, charcoal, clothing and various other products.

Alex says that his main aim is to expand his business which would make it easier for him to travel to other countries in the Americas such as Panama, Peru and Mexico.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Liset Del Carmen

texts.es:
Liset, de 28 años de edad, una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, estudio hasta noveno grado, pues su condición económica no le permitieron seguir estudiando, actualmente está casada, su esposo es albañil, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su suegra, pero las únicas personas que dependen de ella son sus 2 hijos y su esposo.

Liset, su principal actividad es la venta de antojitos típicos como tamales, atol, pupusas, panes con pollo, pues gracias a esto ella puede obtener ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad y gracias a sus ganancias ha logrado sacar su familia adelante junto a su esposo, aparte de esta actividad también se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa, no tiene horario fijo, porque ella tiene que salir a vender sus producto casa por casa. 

Liset, necesita el crédito para comprar una plancha para pupusas y un horno microonda, para hacer su trabajo de una mejor manera, desde hace mucho tiempo ella necesitaba está plancha, porque la que tiene esta dañada.

Liset, sueña con ampliar su negocio y colocar un restaurante de comida rápida y típica, además junto con su esposo desean construir su propia casa y también desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
28 year old Liset is a very hard-working person who is dedicated to her family. She studied up to the ninth grade, but then her economic situation did not permit her to continue studying. Now she is married, her husband is a builder, and they have 2 children aged 6 and 2. She currently lives with her mother-in-law, but her only dependents are her 2 children and her husband.
Liset's main activity is the sale of typical snacks such as tamales, atol, pupusas and bread with chicken. Thanks to this she obtains an income for her and her family. She has worked at this activity for a long time and thanks to her earnings she has managed to provide for her family along with her husband. As well as this activity she also does domestic tasks around her home. She doesn't have a fixed schedule, because she has to go out to sell her products door to door.
Liset needs the loan to buy a griddle for pupusas and a microwave oven in order to do her work in a better way. She has needed this griddle for a long time, because the one she has is damaged.
Liset dreams of growing her business and setting up a typical fast food restaurant. Along with her husband, they want to build their own home and also want their children to continue studying so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for pupusas and a microwave oven

loans.name: Akwa

texts.fr: Akwa est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans et mère de trois enfants. Akwa vit à Baguida pour entreprendre son activité. Akwa vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Akwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Akwa demande ce crédit pour acheter des épices, des poissons fumés et des tomates afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Akwa is a married 49-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Baguida for her work. She sells general food products to earn a living and help her family. 

She procures her stock four times a month at the market. She is seeking a loan to buy spices, smoked fish, and tomatoes in order to generate profits that will support her husband with the family expenses and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy two sachets of spices, two trays of smoked fish, and three trays of tomatoes

loans.name: Ramavoarisoa Claire

texts.fr:
Ramavoarisoa Claire est une femme travailleuse et courageuse de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est traiteur. Ils se soutiennent mutuellement même s'ils n'ont pas d'enfants.
Ravaoarisoa Claire vend des chaussures à l'occasion, il y a maintenant cinq ans, c'est une activité qu'elle a hérité de ses propres parents. C'est une femme vraiment combattive même sans enfants, elle voudrait toujours avancer. Elle voudrait toujours développer et améliorer son activité. Les deux époux n'ont pas encore leur propre maison et envisagent d'en construire dès que leurs épargnes leurs permettent. En plus, elle voudrait dès maintenant prévoir un avenir et une retraite très solide.
texts.en:
Ramavoarisoa Claire is a hardworking and brave 46-year-old woman. She is married and her husband is a caterer. They support each other even though they have no children. 

Ramavoarisoa Claire partly works selling shoes. She has done this now for five years. It is a business she inherited from her parents.

This woman is very ambitious, even without children, and she always wishes to advance. She would like to always develop and improve her business. 

Ramavoarisoa Claire and her husband do not yet have their own house, and they envisage to build one when their savings permit it. In addition, Ramavoarisoa Claire would like to now start preparing for the future and a very solid retirement.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy esforzada, que ha ido construyendo su pulpería poco a poco, con ayuda principalmente de su familia,cuenta con el soporte emocional de su esposo e hijo, que le brindan toda la energía que ella necesita para salir adelante y ser una comerciante de éxito. 
En estos momentos ella ha recurrido a la ayuda de Kiva y MiCredito, para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita llenar su inventario de nuevos y más productos, y comprar granos básicos, aceite, comidas enlatadas, gaseosas, frituras, entre otras cosas que sus clientes demandan día a día. En un futuro su meta es poder tener una distribuidora local, además de invertir en otros negocios.
texts.en:
María is a very hard-working woman who has built up her grocery store bit by bit, mainly with help from her family. She counts on emotional support from her husband and son, who give her all the energy she needs to get ahead and be a successful businesswoman.
At this time she has turned to the help of Kiva and MiCredito, in order to give her a loan which would permit her to stock up on new and more products, and to buy basic grains, oil, canned foods, sodas and fried food, among other things, which her customers demand every day.
In the future her goal is to be able to have a local distributor, as well as investing in other businesses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, canned foods, sodas and fried food, among other things.

loans.name: Agbozo

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Agbozo est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Agbozo  vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales pour réaliser ses gains quotidiens. Agbozo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans un marché local du quartier. Agbozo réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Agbozo nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des plateaux d’œufs, des tomates fraiches et du sel pour gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Agbozo is a married woman with four children. She lives in Baguida. She sells general food products and cereals to earn a living. 

Agbozo procures her stock four times a month in the local market. She makes a very good return with her commerce. 

She needs this loan to buy trays of eggs and fresh tomatoes and salt to make profits that will go towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 trays of eggs, three trays of tomatoes, and 25 dozen [packets] of salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Ayedohoin

texts.fr: Agée de 65 ans, Ayédohoin  est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida avec ses quatre enfants à sa charge. Ayédohoin est une commerçante ambulante très dynamique qui vend des fruits pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ayédohoin s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Ayédohoin demande ce crédit pour commander des bananes, des ananas et des oranges pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
At 65 years old, Ayédohoin is a married woman living in Baguida with her four children who are [still] under her care. She is a very dynamic traveling merchant who sells fruits to satisfy her customers. 

Her business brings in the necessary profits to help with her family's needs.

Ayédohoin procures her stock four times a month at the market. She is seeking this loan to order bananas, pineapple, and oranges to sell and earn more profits that will go towards a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy three trays of bananas, 12 pineapples, and six trays of oranges

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Afiwa est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants et habite dans le quartier de Baguida. Afiwa vend des friperies dans son quartier. Afiwa réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Afiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des slips, des habits, Afiwa demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Afiwa is 36. She is married with three children and lives in the Baguida district. Afiwa sells secondhand clothes in her neighbourhood. Afiwa earns a living thanks to her business to help her children. Afiwa stocks up four times a month at the market. To order pants, clothes, Afiwa requests this loan to reach her objectives and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen panties and 04 dozen garments.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Agée de 61 ans, Amivi est une femme mariée et vit à Baguida avec ses six enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins  quotidiens de la famille, Amivi vend des détergents et du  Javel dans son quartier afin de trouver son revenu nécessaire. Amivi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Amivi demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de Javel afin de disposer d’un stock nécessaire pour satisfaire ses clients et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice tiré.
texts.en:
At 61 years old, Amivi is a married woman who lives in Baguida with her six children. To contribute to the family's daily needs, Amivi sells detergent and bleach in her area to earn what is necessary.

Amivi procures her stock once a month at a local market. She is seeking this loan to order cartons of bleach so that she will have enough stock to satisfy her customers and to support her children's education thanks to the profits earned.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of bleach

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан, 53 года, замужем, мать 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Асылкан успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 4 коровы. На 1,20 Га арендованной и 0,60 Га собственной земли она выращивает клевер и хлопок. В собственном тандыре пекут лепешки для собственного потребления и продажи. Бизнес Асылкан на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 8,400 сом (KGS). Асылкан решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки летней веранды и гаража. Асылкан свои доходы будет направлять на развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Asylkan is 53 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education, and works in agriculture. Asylkan is a successful farmer of her small farm, where she has 4 cows. She grows clover and cotton on 1.20 hectares of rented land, and 0.60 hectares of her own land. She bakes flatbreads in her own tandoor for personal consumption and for sale. Today, Asylkan's business brings in a monthly profit of around 8,400 som (KGS). Asylkan decided to turn to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS), to buy construction materials to build a summer terrace and garage. Asylkan will direct her income towards the development of her business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a summer terrace and garage.

loans.name: Bubuazhar

texts.ru: Бубуажар, 64 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование среднее. На протяжении 21 года она занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход Бубуажар на сегодняшний день доходит до 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бубуажар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она также хочет отремонтировать сараи.
texts.en: Bubuazhar is 64 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education, and over the past 21 years has worked in animal husbandry. Today on her farm she has 3 cows and 30 sheep. Bubuazhar's monthly income can be up to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her total number of livestock. With income from the loan Bubuazhar plans to invest in the further development of her business, and also wants to repair her barn.

loans.use: To buy sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Argen

texts.en: Argen has taken out a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their farmland. She hopes that this will lead to the farmland yielding  a bigger harvest. Argen deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their farmland

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу, 57 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Айсулуу 35 лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня есть корова, 8 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, ее деятельность приносит прибыль около 13,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и проведение ремонта в доме.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 57 years old, and married with 3 grown-up, independent children. 35 years ago, Aisuluu started to work in agriculture as a source of income for her family. Today she has a cow and 8 sheep. Thanks to Aisuluu's persistent hard work, her work brings in a profit of around 13,000 som (KGS). She turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her total number of livestock. With the income, Aisuluu plans to invest in the further expansion of the business and in repairing her home.

loans.use: To buy sheep in order to increase her number of livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 55, is a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Josephine runs a buy-and-sell nipa business (nipa are leaves from the nipa palm) in the Philippines, which she has done for the past 15 years.

She has now requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa (leaves from the nipa palm) to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela, aged 68, is from Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and manages her own rice field with the help of her husband. 

For this cropping season, she is taking out a loan of PHP 12,000 to pay for seedbed preparation and to purchase fertilizer. Marcela hopes for an abundant harvest this season so she can maintain her good credit standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed preparation and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Aloran-Oroquieta City, she took out a loan for her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Evangeline feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her farming business. Recently, she took out a loan to pay labor costs in land preparation for the next crop season.

loans.use: to pay labor costs in land preparation.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hard-working entrepreneur with five children. She has a general store in the Philippines. In addition, she earns income through other business ventures such as selling charcoal and raising livestock.

Raquel has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Lalin

texts.en:
Lalin, aged 49, is married with two children, one of whom is in school, She works very hard to provide for them. Lalin has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 25 years.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lalin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zhiydagul

texts.ru: Жийдагул, 37 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Жийдагул- среднее образование, она работает уборщицей в двух местах. Ежемесячная совокупная заработная плата Жийдагул составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). Жийдагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 44,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дверей, окон, обоев для проведения ремонтных работ в доме и улучшения жилищных условий. Доходы Жийдагул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее благоустройство жилья.
texts.en:
Zhiydagul is 37 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works as a cleaner in two different places. Her total monthly income is about 9,000 KGS.

Zhiydagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 44,000 KGS to purchase doors, windows and wallpaper to carry out home renovations and improve her living conditions. She will put her income toward further improving her home.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, wallpaper, etc. in order to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is 54 years old and married. She has a rice retailing business that primarily supports her family. Marites wants to finish the repair of their boarding house from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy building materials and to pay her workers. Recently, she took out a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy building materials and paint, and to pay her workers for repairs to the boarding house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint, and pay her workers for boarding house repairs.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María Raquel tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con un hijo a su cargo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

María Raquel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto María Raquel espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Raquel is 41 years old and lives in the family home with one son in her care. She lives in a rural are of the Cayaltí district which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people in this district mainly work in farming, cattle and business.

María Raquel raises and sells small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys, amongst others. She runs her business from her own home. She has had two years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. 

The loan that María Raquel is applying for will be used to buy a larger amount of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys and chickens, amongst others, as well as balanced meals for them. With this loan María Raquel hopes to offer a better product to her customers which will allow her to generate a higher income and increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to raise them

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is 59 years old, and married with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

Ada has borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Ada aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Delia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Wilson Darwin

texts.es: Darwin esta en sus 47 años de edad, Darwin creció en el campo y comenta que sus padres le enseñaron las actividades de agricultura, Darwin tiene 3 hijos y comenta que ya son mayores de edad y de igual manera se dedican a trabajar en  la agricultura, Darwin vive con una hija y una nieta, Darwin solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar abono y fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos y en buen estado. Darwin tiene la aspiración de cuidar lo mejor que pueda sus cultivos y así mejorar su negocio mediante unas buenas cosechas  y producto de calidad y vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Darwin is 47 years of age. He grew up on the land and says that his parents taught him how to farm. Darwin has three children and says that they are all adults now and they also work in farming. He lives with his daughter and his granddaughter. 

Darwin is applying for a loan to buy fertiliser and fungicide to keep his crops healthy and in good condition. Darwin hopes to care for his crops as best he can so that he can improve his business with a good harvest of a quality product that he can sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and fungicide

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 60 years old and married with nine children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Amelita has been in this business for two years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es: Manuel es un señor  de 64 años de edad, Manuel se dedica al jornal de trabajo de agricultura y a la ganadería, Manuel tiene 3 hijos  mayores de edad, Manuel solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra terneros, Manuel comenta que su negocio es comprar terneros, criarlos y después venderlos obteniendo ganancia.  Manuel  tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y de esta manera obtener más recursos económicos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de  junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 64 year old man who dedicates every day to farming and cattle. He has three adult children.

Manuel is applying for a loan to buy calves. He says that his business is buying calves, raising them and later selling them at a profit. Manuel hopes to improve his business so that he can obtain more financial resources to allow him and his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su pequeña finca de 11.28 hectáreas, de las cuales 5.66 son de café los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo.

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 120 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual para este año ha tomado como un reto, proponiéndose incrementar este rendimiento productivo y alcanzar una cosecha de al menos 200 quintales. 

Para lograr su meta, Carlos está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere para asegurar la demanda nutricional de su plantación. Esta inversión se sumará al esfuerzo y trabajo que él y su familia vienen realizando en su finca para alcanzar mayores resultados y de esa forma mejorar su condición económica.
in
texts.en:
Carlos is a coffee producer in the north area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and two children in their small farm of 11.28 hectares, of which 5.66 are coffee which he produces under the criteria of the fair trade certification.

In recent years, this coffee producer has achieved a harvest of around 120 quintals (about 5,500 kg) of parchment coffee. This year he has taken as a challenge, aiming to increase the yield and achieve a harvest of at least 200 quintals (about 9,200 kg).

To achieve its goal , Carlos is requesting a loan to enable him to purchase supplies and fertilizers required to ensure the nutritional demand of his plantation. This investment will be added to the effort and work that he and his family have been making on his farm in order to achieve better results and thus improve their economic condition.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers needed for his coffee plantation and to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona owns a sari-sari store in Tudela. 

Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her store. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase commodities such as canned goods, vinegar, oil, soy sauce and soaps.

loans.use: to purchase commodities such as canned goods, vinegar, oil, soy sauce and soaps.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is supervising the renovation of their home. 

Catalina hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 15,000. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 62 years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Wilma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

In the future, Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Anabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell wood business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Anabelle is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more wood like coco lumber to sell.

Anabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more wood like coco lumber to sell.

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
Andrés es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 1.76  hectáreas de las cuales 1.4 son de café. En los últimos años ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 18 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo procesos de certificación: Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su finca con el sueño de dar a sus 4 hijos mejores condiciones económicas y dejarles un legado. 

Uno de los mayores retos que enfrenta este productor en su finca es el control de las plagas y enfermedades del café, tales como la antracnosis la cual provoca manchas en las hojas y frutos.

Para garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones, este pequeño productor está solicitando para este ciclo un financiamiento que le permita la adquisición de insumos y fertilizantes para el manejo agronómico del café, lo cual le permitirá además incrementar la producción en un 20%, todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para alcanzar la sostenibilidad y reinversión en su finca.
texts.en:
Andrés is a coffee producer in the northern area of Nicaragua. His farm is 1.76 hectares of which 1.4 are for coffee. In recent years, he has managed a harvest of about 18 quintals (about 828 kg) of parchment coffee, which is produced under certification processes: Fairtrade , UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices. This small producer has been improving his farm with the dream of giving his 4 children the best economic conditions and leave them a legacy.

One of the biggest challenges facing this producer on his farm is controlling pests and diseases on his coffee, such as anthracnose, which causes spots on the leaves and fruit.

To ensure a plan of integrated pest and disease control in their plantations, this small producer is applying for this loan cycle a loan that allows him to purchase supplies and fertilizers for the coffee crop management, which will also allow an increased production of 20%. This will result in better incomes in order to become sustainable and reinvestment in the farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers needed for his coffee plantation and achieve a good production this cycle.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 33 years old and married with six children, who are all still in school. Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.  

Felisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and  personal care products.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es un pequeño productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. A sus 60 años de edad, este productor cuenta con mucha energía para continuar trabajando su pequeña finca en la cual cuenta con 2.82 hectáreas de café. Aunque su grado de escolaridad no superó la primaria, esto no ha sido impedimento para que este pequeño productor pueda administrar su finca, y enseñarles el valor de la educación a sus 4 hijos. 

Como parte del mejoramiento de los procesos productivos que Manuel ha venido realizando en su finca, este año está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permita disminuir los costos de mantenimiento; ya que hasta la fecha compra estos productos en reventa. Su meta es poder mejorar nutricionalmente su café lo que le dará como resultados mejores rendimientos y calidad, y con ello obtener mayores ingresos para darle a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Manuel is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. At 60 years of age, this producer has plenty of energy to continue working in his small farm, which has 2.82 hectares of coffee plants. Although his education level did not reach more than elementary school, this has not been an impediment for this small producer to manage his farm and to teach the value of education to his 4 children.

As part of the improvements of the productive processes that Manual has been implementing in his farm, this year he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will permit him to decrease his maintenance costs, as he currently buys this products from a reseller. His goal is to be able to improve the nutrition for his coffee [plants], which will produce better yields and quality, and so to obtain a higher income to give his family better [living] conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plants to decrease maintenance costs and have higher profits

loans.name: María Deisy

texts.es:
Deysi, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a que su familia no tenía suficientes recursos económicos, está soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, en su casa habitan tres personas, de las cuales solamente su hijo depende de ella.

Deysi, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además de dedicarse a esta valiosa actividad, también se dedica a vender productos para el cuidado personal por catálogo y de esas ganancias que obtiene puede sacar para suplir lo necesario para su hijo, ella sale a ofrecer estos productos por las tardes a sus amigos y vecinos.

Deysi, necesita el crédito para comprar más productos de uso personal y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias económicas.

Deysi, sueña con tener su propia casa y vivir más cómodamente con su hijo; también desea poder ayudarle a su hijo para que estudie la carrera de su elección.
texts.en:
Deysi, who studied until the ninth grade because her family did not have sufficient financial resources, is single and has a 1-year-old son. She is living in a house with three people, of which only her son is dependent on her.

Deysi, who makes a living through domestic chores, besides dedicating to this valuable activity, also sells products for personal care via a catalog. From these profits she can take what is needed to meet the needs of her son. She goes out to offer these products in the afternoons to her friends and neighbors.

Deysi needs a loan to buy more personal care products and offer her customers more variety. This will provide better economic returns.

Deysi dreams of owning her own home and living more comfortably with her son. She also wants to help her son to study the career of his choice.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita  is 79 years old, residing at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Mis.Occ.

She joined PMPC in order to access its programs and services. 

Recently, she has accessed her 12th loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of commodities for her sari-sari store business, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. 

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. 

Paz hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Famela

texts.en:
Famela is married and has one child.

Famela works hard to support her family. She has a direct selling business in the Philippines. Famela has been in this business for 10 years now, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Famela requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like beauty kits, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products like beauty kits, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family.

Corazon is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Corazon has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who is never too tired to support her family. Recently, she took out a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional piglets for fattening. She intends to add pigs for commercial sale in nearby municipalities. Someday she hopes to open a butcher shop in their town.

loans.use: to buy more of piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 66-year-old member of PMPC who lives at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

He learned about Paglaum MPCs' various services offered to its members, so he decided to become one. 

Currently, he is obtaining a loan of PHP 18,000 to pay for his medical check up.

loans.use: to pay for his medical check up.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC, having no previous defaults on her loans. She decided to take out another loan, of PHP 3,000, to buy bags of fertilizer for her corn farm. She hopes that she can increase her production during this cropping season.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She supplements her income with earnings from her firewood retail business. Angelina dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and create financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Panglan Indah Group

texts.en:
The Panglan Indah group's repayment is presented by the head of the group, Ni Wayan, because most of the members are working in their gardens. During the loan term, all the members can sell their pigs and earn satisfactory profits. With increased knowledge from the training they received, they can manage their pigs well.
