Ni Wayan has sold all her pigs. With the profit she earned, she can save and support her children’s education, by buying books and covering their other school needs. 

She’s very happy and decided to take out a new loan to increase her business. Entering their fourth loan, most the members of Panglan Indah group have sows and local pigs for barbequing. The local pigs will sell every two months. As the group head, Ni Wayan has become a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase three super-quality piglets. She buy feed with her own money, with her husband’s help. She’s really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK, and the lenders for supporting her business and her group. Now she can add to her husband’s income, to meet their daily needs. One member is not pictured because she’s at the hospital for her daughter’s treatments.

loans.use: to buy three super-high quality piglets.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which rears poultry. 

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy birds,feeders,drinkers, and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and boost economic status. Ibrahim hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wholesale business. 

Ibrahim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ibrahim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy birds, feeders, drinkers for his expanding poultry business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda continúa trabajando como profesora rural. Él préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en los gastos de materiales y cavado de zanja por donde pasará la tubería. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. El motivo de su solicitud es para realizar la conexión de agua potable en su baño, cocina y lavandería, “ya realizamos la obra gruesa que era el cavado de una zanja, compré el material y sólo falta la mano de obra fina para que podamos tener agua en casa…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realiza la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos dejen de usar agua contaminada. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que construye su casa. 
Es por esos motivos que Hilda solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos dejen de usar agua contaminada de pozo.
texts.en: Hilda continues working as a teacher in a rural school. She invested her previous loan in the cost of materials and excavation of the trench through which the water pipe will pass. Her repayment of installments was punctual because she had no problems. The purpose of this loan request is to complete the connection of running water to her bathroom, kitchen and washroom: "We have already done the heavy work of digging a trench; I bought the materials and all that is needed now is the skilled labor to be able to have water in the house," she says. Her dream is to have running water in her house and she wants to install it in the kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that her children no longer have to use contaminated water. This is the second sequence of loans with this institution since the construction of the house 18 years ago. For these reasons, Hilda is asking for a loan for the installation of running water in her kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that her children don't use contaminated well water.

loans.use: with the installation of clean drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry area so that her children no longer have to use contaminated well water

loans.name: Job Jonathan

texts.es:
Job, de 24 años de edad, estudio bachillerato contador, está soltero y vive solo con sus padres. 

Job, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, trabaja junto a su padre en una parcela cerca de su casa, pero también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

Job, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para la milpa, de esa manera podrá obtener una mejor cosecha.

Job, en un futuro sueña con obtener un crédito más grande, para poder construir su propia casa y tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Job, age 24, studied accounting in high school.  He is single and lives with just his parents.

Job has worked in agriculture for the past two years.  He works together with his father on a parcel of land near his house.  He also works buying and selling cattle.

Job needs this loan to buy fertilizers for his field.  In this way he will be able to get a better harvest.

In the future, Job dreams of getting a bigger loan in order to be able to build his own house and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his field

loans.name: Irish Ann

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Irish Ann works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling home products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling personal items. Irish Ann is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more home products to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, dejo sus estudios porque prefirió irse de su casa a trabajar a otro departamento en una tienda, todo para ayudar más a su familia con los gastos del hogar, está casada y tiene un hijo de 10 meses de nacido, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil y en su casa solo vive ella junto a su esposo y su bebe.

Sandra, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, ya que no puede salir de su casa por cuidar a su niño, pero cuando su hijo este más grande regresara nuevamente a trabajar siempre en la misma tienda, por lo tanto tendrá que viajar otra vez lejos de casa y pero esta vez se ira junto a su esposo e hijo, porque no quiere alejarse de ellos.

Sandra, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas y fertilizantes, porque quiere sembrar maíz y frijoles; con esto estará asegurando una buena producción de granos y la alimentación de su familia. 

Ella, sueña con poder darle la oportunidad a su hijo para que estudio y se gradué de una carrera universitaria, además desea tener una casa propia, porque en la que viven es de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Sandra is 20 years old and studied up to sixth grade but she quit because she wanted to leave home in order to work in a shop in another department. She did all this to further help her family with the household expenses. She is married, has a 10 month old boy and her husband works as a builder. She lives together with her husband and baby.

Sandra looks after the home and can't go out due to caring for her child. However, when her son is older she will return to work in the same shop.  She will therefore have to travel far from her home again but this time she will go together with her husband and son because she doesn't want to be away from them. 

Sandra needs the loan in order to buy manure, pesticides, insecticides and fertilizers because she wants to plant corn and beans. With this she will be able to guarantee the production of good crops and be able to feed her family. 

She has the dream of being able to give her son the opportunity to study and that he will be able to graduate from university.  She also wants to have her own house as the one she lives in is her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle manages her sari-sari (variety store) business in Ozamiz City. The business has been doing well in supporting the needs of her family. 

Michelle would also accept catering jobs for additional income. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase cooking utilities for her eatery business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils for her eatery business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 59 years old, a widow, and has a rice field at Tangub City. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, Angelita accessed a loan to purchase nipa thatch for roofing, wood, nails and sticks for house repair. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase nipa (woven palm frond) thatch, wood, nails and sticks for house repair

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 48 years old, a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. 

She has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Beverly requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Beverly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Beverly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 41 years old and married with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Janette is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janette has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store and poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading.  Julieta is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  buy more products such as beauty kits, face powders, beauty soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products such as beauty kits, face powders, beauty soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, soft drinks, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Lorna would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 41 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods for the shop, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to construct his own commercial house. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more essential goods for his general shop so as to pay school fees

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and add capital to business. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more automobile spare parts to generate greater profits and add capital to his business

Marilou has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Siony

Siony has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is so thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan for the maintenance of her jeepney unit, which was necessary for efficient and safe service. Although her transportation business entails a lot of challenges, it does not deter her from persevering and believing that she can overcome every trial in life. 

She is now humbly asking for another loan of PHP 15,000 for the continuous maintenance of her jeepney. The key to a smooth and consistent service is the regular maintenance of her vehicle.  She will be very grateful if she can again avail your financial aid, and she is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart. Her earnings will surely cover their daily needs and help fund her children's education.

Eva's simple dream is to see all her children go to College and become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on her jeepney.

Pervelyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Sally has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

Ma. Elnor has borrowed and paid five loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

She aspires to building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Alma

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her tailoring shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Alma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, sardines, etc., to sell

loans.name: Viola

She has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising poultry.  Viola is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks of personal collection items like cosmetics, beauty soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Viola has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Milagros

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a bathroom, septic tank and toilet at their home, to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells saucepans,kettles,frying pans. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sauce pans,kettles,frying pans, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and change life style. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to turn to whole sale business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more saucepans, kettles, frying pans etc, to increase profit and improve his family lifestyle

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is married with two children. She has a weaving business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Lucilyn has been in the weaving business for 10 years now. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy materials for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Alpha has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
María, es madre de 2 hijos, estudió hasta cuarto grado, tiene 11 hermanos y a sus padres les fue difícil darles lo necesario debido a la situación económica que pasaban, por esa razón empezó desde muy joven a ayudarle a su madre con los oficios domésticos; ahora está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor.

María, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde que está acompañada, su pareja es quien le enseño este trabajo, como fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia; además de trabajar sus propio cultivos, María también vende antojitos para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos de la casa; para ir a sus cultivos tiene que caminar 1 kilómetro desde su vivienda y su hijo y su pareja ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, semilla y pesticidas para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, está vez implementara una nueva variedad de semilla, con la cual espera mejores cosechas.

María, desea en un futuro ampliar sus cultivos arrendando más tierras y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a mother of two and studied up to the fourth grade. She has 11 brothers and sisters, and it was difficult for her parents to give them what they needed because of the economic situation they were in. For that reason, she started helping her mother with domestic tasks at a very young age. Now she is in a relationship and her partner is a farmer.
María has spent her time sowing basic grains like maize and beans since she has been in the relationship, as her partner taught her the work as a source of income to sustain the family. As well as working with her own crops, María also sells snacks to help her partner with the expenses at home. To get to her crops she has to walk 1 kilometer from her home and her son and partner help with the work.
The loan will be used to buy manure, seed and pesticides for her cultivation of maize and beans. This time she will introduce a new variety of seed, with which she hopes for better harvests.
María wants to widen her cultivation in the future by leasing more land and thereby being able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed and pesticides for her cultivation of maize and beans.

loans.name: Basilisa

Basilisa has been fattening pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Basilisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

Mailene is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation for her tailoring business. She will use the loan to buy additional cloth, thread and needles and to pay for maintenance on her sewing machine.

Mailene has sustained her business activities through two previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, thread and needles and pay for maintenance on her sewing machine

The loan will be used to buy soap,salt,sugar,bread,eggs,detergent.cooking oil and other items, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and expand business. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase more stock. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, detergent, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronald is 41 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his cosmetic shop, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic items, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wider range of cosmetic shops. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cosmetic items for his store

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a 25 years old and single. He wants to help his parents and is engaged in a transport business to earn income. 

He aims for a better income so he borrowed a loan to buy motor parts so that he can continue to cater tp more passengers. This will create greater income.

Amor plan to save money to finish his course.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 48-year-old married man and they have one child to provide for. 

As a father, Angel always wants what is the best for his family. So he engaged in a transport business to provide for his family's needs. He aims for a better income because of the needed demands of his family. 

Therefore, Angel decided to take a loan to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance so that he can continue to cater to more passengers that will create greater income.

Angel's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle for his business expansion.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 28 years old and both of her children are sent to school.

Marilyn has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy beauty products for her beauty salon.

Marilyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 54 years old, married, and has seven children.

Gina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anamay

texts.en:
Anamay is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, can goods, noodles, spices, etc.

Anamay has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 38 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are sent to school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arsenia has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Catalina has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 54 years old and has six children. Natividad is married and has one child still in school.

Natividad is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

Natividad has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 39, is married with four children. One of her children is still in school. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analiza has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell in the market.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 54, is married and has five children. Two of her children are still in school.

She works in agricultural in the Philippines, specifically in pig fattening. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Anita has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anita has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman, 55 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Beverly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a fish net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Beverly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business.

loans.name: M. Fiaz

texts.en:
M. Fiaz is a milkman in his community and has been selling milk for many years. He is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert at producing milk from a buffalo; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. 

He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day due to a fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members. 

M. Fiaz wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary. 

He wants to establish his business and with this loan buy an additional buffalo so that he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family. 

M. Fiaz thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a farming sugarcane in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorna has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the farming sugarcane for two years and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shorts, shoes, shirts, etc. to sell for her ready-to-wear products business. Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. Lorna earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rowena has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market. Rowena has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Divas, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras KIARA YAZUARA, MERYLU MAGDALENAy PAULINA AUXILIADORA), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 9 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

PAULINA AUXILIADORA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora luchadora de 53 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad e independientes, el de 16 años de edad cursa su primer año de ingeniería en informática en una de las universidades de Bilwi y el menor de 14 años estudia su cuarto año de secundaria. Con gran esfuerzo ha sacado adelante sola a sus hijos, al establecer su pequeño comedor de comida cacera. Esta solicitando su tercer financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar: Vigoron, frito, enchiladas, refrescos naturales. Gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus negocios, vender ropa usada. Ella sueña con vender calzado de Masaya y ropa nueva, para incrementar su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
The Las Divas solidarity group is made up of 3 enterprising women (Kiara Yazuara, Merylu Magdalena and Paulina Auxiliadora). They live in the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They got together 9 months ago with the proposal of working in a supportive way to get access to loans from Pana Pana, which would allow them to increase the inventories of their small businesses and thereby improve bit by bit the living conditions of their families.
Paulina Auxiliadora is a member of the solidarity group and a tenacious woman of 53 years of age as well as a single mother to 6 children. 4 are adults and independent, the 16 year old is studying his first year of computer engineering at one of the universities in Bilwi, and the 14 year old is studying his fourth year of secondary school. With great effort she has managed to provide for her children on her own, by establishing her small cafeteria selling home-cooked food.
She is asking for her third loan to buy consumables and ingredients to make Vigorón, fried food, enchiladas and fresh drinks. Thanks to the loans given by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, she has been able to diversify her businesses to sell second-hand clothing. She dreams of selling footwear from Masaya and new clothing to increase her level of income.

loans.use: to buy consumables and ingredients to make Vigorón, fried food, enchiladas and fresh drinks.

loans.name: Jouvelin

texts.en:
Jouvelin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jouvelin is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jouvelin has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Jouvelin has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jouvelin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Donna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation.  Donna is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to  buy additional bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Donna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Shiela Mae is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional storage boxes for the fish she sells to customers. Shiela Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional storage boxes for selling fish

loans.name: Jorlyn

texts.en:
Jorlyn is 51 years old and married.

Jorlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jorlyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Jorlyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jorlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 50 years old, married, with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 7 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa, 57, is married with two children. He is an internally displaced person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. His wife doesn’t earn an income. 

Mustafa is an electrician. He started his business five years ago. He is a skilled, respected, organized, stable and professional person.

Although he has experience, he is not happy with his work because he cannot earn the good income he needs. If he had enough money, he would buy new electronic equipment and appliances. 

His biggest dream is to expand his business, so he is seeking support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand his electrical business

loans.name: Buelah

texts.en:
Buelah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store and upholstery businesses.

Buelah dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Kim Ajan

texts.en:
Kim Ajan, 39, is married with two children. Both children are in school. 

Kim Ajan is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional clothing stock to sell.

In the future, Kim Ajan would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: M. Anwar

texts.en:
M. Anwar is the age of 55; he is an honest person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been conducting his dairy business for many years and generating income for his family. 

He is milkman by profession; he sells milk in his community and bull calves to the butchers. He has a few cows; he produces milk two times in a day from his cattle. He provides door-to-door milk to his customers also, and takes money on monthly basis. 

He found that he can produce more milk from buffaloes instead of cows, so he made a plan to buy buffalo. But the buffalo price is more than a cow, and he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a buffalo.

Therefore, M. Anwar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to buy one buffalo for producing more milk to sell.

M. Anwar wants to keep buffaloes instead of cows to grow his business and wants to maintain his cowshed through the profit amount because he does not have proper shelter for his cattle, as well.
 
M. Anwar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for producing milk then selling in the market and community.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his brick laying business, which makes bricks. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for more bricks, and will help Edward to generate greater profits and improve business. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy materials for making more bricks

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Isma is 33 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Isma has been working hard to manage his spare parts business, which deals in spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Isma has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Isma to generate greater profits and increase profits. Isma hopes that in the future he will be able to create another branch. 

Isma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more spare parts for his auto spare parts store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 41 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 59 years old, married and has two children.

Daisy is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Daisy has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lorna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 44 years old, and three of her children are presently in school.

Edna has a buying and selling of personal products business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock like beauty soap, cosmetics, shampoo, body lotion and other beauty care products.

Edna has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like beauty soap, cosmetics, shampoo, body lotion and other beauty care products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Maribel has been in this business for five years. Maribel earns more income from a buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Maribel is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos los cuales son independiente, originaria del departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del pais, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable en sus formas de pago, trabajadora y de escasos recursos económicos, el cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio que consiste en una hermosa pulperia bien surtida, comoda y accesible a sus clientes donde ofrece productos basicos como arroz, azucar, frijoles, aceite, maiz, pan productos lacteos, jugos, gaseosas,golosinas, mecates, leña, papel higienicos, cafe, avenas, condimentos, cosmeticos, ropa interior, sandalias entre otros mas productos, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y en algunas veces al credito, sus compras las realiza, en distribuidoras, camiones y mercados de esta misma localidad, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio a sus clientes los cuales a las 5:00am ya esta atendiendo, cerrado 10:00pm su clientela ha ido incrementando gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado y de esa forma surtir mas su negocio con nueva mercaderia y la buena atencion que ella les brinda a sus clientes, uno de sueños es poder crecer un poco mas en su negocio y realizar ciertas mejoras en su hogar para su mismo negocio, hoy en dia Vicenta esta solicitando nuevamente Credito para invertir en capital de trabajo y de esa forma lograr cumplir con varios pedidos que le han encargado, el cual ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos econocomicos.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro, an older woman who is married with three grown children, is from Chinandegana which is located in the west of the country. She is known for being an enterprising woman, responsible about paying her installments, hardworking and with few economic resources.
She has been growing her business bit by bit, which consists of a lovely, well-stocked, comfortable and accessible grocery store where she sells basic items such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, maize, bread, dairy products, juices, sodas, candies, ropes, firewood, toilet paper, coffee, oats, condiments, cosmetics, underwear and sandals, among other products. She has regular and occasional clients and her sales are in cash or in some cases on credit. Her purchases are made from distributors, delivery trucks and markets in the local area. She starts her day very early by opening the doors of her business to her clients who are already waiting at 5am, and she closes at 10pm. Her customer base has grown thanks to the attention which she pays to her clients and the support which she has been given and in this way she has stocked her business with new merchandise.
One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business a bit more to make certain home improvements for that same business. Today Vicenta is asking for a loan again to invest in working capital and in that way manage to meets the various orders which are outstanding. She is very grateful for the support which Kiva lenders offer to people of lower financial means.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy consumable home products and general merchandise products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, and she has three children. 

Mary operates a retail business where she sells cereals, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Mary will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old, married and has six children. Her family relies on income through rice farming. 

Jocelyn wants to improve crop production but she needs additional capital to buy farm inputs. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help ensure good growth of crops that will give a good harvest in return. 

Jocelyn promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: eggs, flour, butter, and propane to increase her business sales

loans.name: Malunda

texts.en:
Mahunda is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mahunda has been working hard to manage his produce business, which deals in produce. 

To help expand his business, Mahunda has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce and will help Mahunda to generate greater profits and increase stock. Mahunda hopes that in the future he will be able to develop land. 

Mahunda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mahunda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more farm supplies produce

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food supplies for her business so that she can continue to study gastronomy with the profits

loans.name: Birna Jessica

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Jave - Jireh.
En este lugar vive la señora Birna, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, la menor estudia en universidad y vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer. Ella es licenciada en educación parvularia.
Doña Birna es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene una escuela de educación especial en su casa, allí se dedica a educar y ayudar a niños con capacidades especiales. Requiere del crédito para adecuar mejor su centro de enseñanzas y brindar un mejor servicio a los pequeños que asisten a su centro, ella también vende ropa, carteras y otros artículos, los mismos que vende en su casa y puerta a puerta,  lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante brindando un servicio en bien de la sociedad. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, carteras para la venta, sillas, mesas y material didáctico para la educación de los pequeños. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo de Jave-Jireh meet every 15 days in the La Paz housing community in the city of Portoviejo.  Ever since colonial times it has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

This is where Birna, age 49, lives.  She is married, and they have four children, who are all grown.  The youngest attends the university and lives in their house.  Her husband is a driver.  She has a degree in early childhood education.

Birna is a very hard-working woman, who likes to be self-sufficient in order to get ahead.  She has a special education school at her house.  She teaches and helps children with special needs.  

She needs the loan to better adapt her learning center and to provide better service to the little ones who attend her center. 

She also sells clothes, purses, and other items at her house and by going door to door.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over ten years.  It helps her to get ahead by providing a service to others.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and purses to sell.  She will also buy chairs, tables, and educational materials for the little ones.

She has been in her loan group for five years.  She likes it because she gets ahead with the loans.  Her dream is to have a bigger place in order to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, chairs, tables, and educational materials.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 66 años de edad, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Mercedes se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Mercedes espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 66, has a child under her care.  She lives in a rural area in the Cayaltí district.  It is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district devote themselves mainly to agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

Mercedes raises and sells small animals like chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others.  Her business is located at her house.  She has years of experience in the business, and she has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others.  She will also buy balanced feed for them.  By doing so Mercedes hopes to offer her customers a better product.  This will allow her to generate greater income that will improve her quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Rocío Del Carrmen

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Jave - Jireh.
En este lugar vive la señora Rocío, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  26, 24 y 14 años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio y todos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo es panadero. 
Doña Rocío junto a su familia  tienen una panadería en un su casa, allí ellos elaboran roscas de dulce y de sal, una vez que ellos elaboran estos productos su marido y su hijo salen a vender por toda la ciudad  todos los días, sus ventas siempre son muy buenas y sus clientes los prefieren por lo deliciosos de sus productos, ya son más de  26 años trabajando en esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar un horno eléctrico que mucha falta les hace y muchos otros ingredientes para preparar las roscas. Lleva tres ciclos  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un buen  local.
texts.en:
The members of the "De Jave - Jireh" communal bank meet every fortnight in the La Paz citadel of the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of Royal Tamarinds 

Rocío lives here. She is 45 years old, married and from this relationship has three children aged 26, 24 and 14 years old. The youngest studies at Secondary school and all of them still live at home. Her husband is a baker. 

Rocio together with her family have a bakery in their house. Here they make sweet and salty roscas (bread rolls). Every day once they are made her husband and son go out to sell them throughout the city. Their sales are always very good and their clients prefer them as their products are delicious. They have been in this business which allows them to earn their living for more than 26 years. This loan is to buy an electric oven which they need badly and many other ingredients to make the roscas. She has been in the communal bank for three loans and she likes it for the support the loans provide.Her dream is to have a good store.

loans.use: to buy an electric oven and supplies.

loans.name: Amalia Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Jave - Jireh.
En este lugar vive la señora Amalia, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 17 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Amalia junto a su marido se dedican al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa donde todos los días vende pollos ya sea enteros o por libras, su marido todos los días de desplaza a una granja que hay por la ciudad donde compra los pollos a muy buen precio, luego en casa junto a ella los faenan y venden, mientras ella vende en su local él se encarga de ir a distribuir por la ciudad a clientes frecuentes que siempre le compran, de esta forma ellos logran ganarse algo con lo cual sacan adelante a sus hijas, lleva más de 1 año con esta actividad la cual empezaron con un crédito.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar pollos, aguas, jugos y sodas. Lleva más de un año  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que  le dan con los créditos.  Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo de Jave-Jireh meet every 15 days in the La Paz housing community in the city of Portoviejo.  Ever since colonial times it has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

This is where Amalia, age 39, lives.  She is married, and they have two daughters, ages 17 and 13.  The children go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Amalia works in commerce together with her husband.  She has a place at her house where she sells whole chickens or chicken by the pound every day.  Every day her husband goes to a farm in the city where he buys the chickens for a very good price.  

Later, at their house they cut them up and sell them.  While she sells at her place, he takes charge of distributing them to regular customers in the city who always buy them.  This way they manage to earn something with which to get their daughters ahead.  They have been engaged in this business activity for over a year.  They started the business with a loan.

She will use this loan to stock her business more.  She will buy chickens, water, juices, and sodas.  

She has been in her loan group for one year.  She likes it because of the help that the loans give her.  

Her dream is to give the best to her daughters.

loans.use: buy chickens, water, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Elmerlinda

texts.en:
Elmerlinda is a married woman, 38 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elmerlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elmerlinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Elmerlinda has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 47 years old and married with one child. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and other personal care products.

Elsie has been in this business for ten years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and other personal care products.

loans.name: Gulchihra

texts.ru: Гульчихра, 41 год, в разводе, мама 2 сыновей. У Гульчихры среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей товарами широкого назначения, стартовав 12 лет назад с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульчихры, в обороте есть товар на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульчихра обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продукции для увеличения товарооборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Гульчихра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulchihra is 41 years old, divorced, and the mother of two sons.  She has a secondary education.  In order to bring an income home, she has been selling staple goods for the past 12 years, having started with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has 300,000 som (KGS) worth of merchandise.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy additional goods in order to increase her shop's turnover.  She is planning to use the proceeds from her loan to further develop her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy products to sell on a retail basis in her shop.

loans.name: Muhtabar

texts.ru: Мухтабар, 63 года, замужем, есть сын. У Мухтабар средне-специальное образование, сейчас на пенсии, много лет проработала медицинской сестрой в больнице. Уже 35 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 20 овец, 5 лошадей, кролики. На ежедневной основе продает экологически-чистое молоко, на 1,20 Га земли она выращивает перец и клевер. Доход Мухтабар составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения удоя молока, часть средств будет направлена на полеводство. В будущем Мухтабар хочет накопить на поездку с супругом на курорт, чтобы отдохнуть и поправить здоровье.
texts.en: Muhtabar is 63 years old, married, and she has a son.  She has a specialized secondary education. She is now retired after working for many years as a nurse in a hospital.  Additionally, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 35 years.  She currently has two cows, 20 sheep, five horses and a few rabbits on her farm.  She sells organic milk on a daily basis and also grows pepper and clover on 1.2 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a few dairy cows and sell larger volumes of milk.  She will use the extra money to cultivate her land.  In the future, Muhtabar wants to save enough money to travel with her husband to a health resort where she will be able to rest and improve their health.

loans.use: to buy a few dairy cows (in order to sell larger volumes of milk), and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Grupo El Potrero Group

texts.es:
Santos (se ubica en medio de  la fotografía)  un hombre que le encanta compartir con la belleza de la naturaleza,  para Santos trabajar en el campo es una gran bendición porque es de donde proviene sus ingresos, él cuenta  que con el apoyo del crédito logro comprar sus insumos agrícolas para que su cultivo diera una buena cosecha, afortunadamente hoy en día su cultivo ha incrementado y con ello sus ingresos es por eso que con el afán de seguir mejorando sus ingresos solicita un préstamo para poder comprar semillas y fertilizantes y cultivar en esta ocasión unas cuerdas de papas, Santos guarda las esperanzas de seguir contando con el crédito para que su cultivo siga incrementado.
Santos tiene el anhelo de poder contar algún día con el apoyo de una empresa que exporte sus productos en el extranjero para que su ingreso sea mayor.
texts.en:
Santos, (located in the center of the photo), is a man who loves spending time in the beauty of nature. For Santos, working the land is a great blessing because it is the source of his income. He counts on the support of a loan to be able to purchase agricultural supplies so that he gets a good yield from his crops. 

Fortunately, these days his crop has increased, and with it, so has his income. It's for this reason that, with great eagerness to continue improving his income, he is requesting a loan to be able to purchase seeds and fertilizers so that this time he can cultivate potatoes.  

Santos hopes to continue counting on the support of a loan so that his crop will continue to increase. Santos has the desire to be able to one day count on the support of a company that would export his products abroad so that his income could be greater.

loans.use: to be able to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana es madre, hermana y esposa ella trabaja día con día para bridarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, Ana cuenta que gracias al crédito que tuvo la oportunidad de poder acceder logro comprar las llantas y reparo el motor de su taxi, y con este problema resuelto logro sin novedes cancelar su crédito, pero con el constante uso que se le da al taxi ahora nuevamente se ven a la necesidad de realizar algunas reparación para que su único fuente de ingreso siga trabajando sin dificultades , por tal razón solicitan un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Ana es poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa grande para más comodidad de su familia.
texts.en: Ana is a mother, sister and wife. She works each day in order to provide her family with a better quality of living. Ana says that thanks to the previous loan she was able to have the opportunity to buy tires and repair the motor of her taxi and with these problems resolved she was able to pay off her loan with no problems. But with the constant use given the taxi she once again needs to have some repairs made so that her only source of income continues to work without difficulties. So she is requesting a loan to pay for this necessity. Ana's big dream is to be able to buy a plot of land to build a big house so that her family is more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Akhtar Parveen

texts.en:
Akhtar Parveen, aged 42, is a married woman and is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children and this is the reason for her working extremely hard to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to generate maximum income, so that she can cherish her family in better way. This is the reason she wants to buy an additional sewing machine for her assistant and an additional stock of threads, spools, button, laces and zippers.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly boutique keepers and retailers. She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, stock and some stitching material to meet the increasing demand and for generating maximum income. 

Akhtar Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for her assistant, cloth and additional stock of threads, spools, button, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

HILDA NOHEMY: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Girasol, es una señora afable de 34 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada con un hijo que estudia su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal en un salón de belleza. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hijo, desde hace 8 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, pan, huevos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con llegar a tener el capital suficiente para establecer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 enterprising women, who got together 3 years ago with the aim of accessing finance to improve their small businesses by increasing their stock, so they could also improve their income. This allows them to cover their basic household needs, guarantee their children's education and expand their businesses.

Hilda Nohemy is the coordinator of the Girasol group. She is a friendly 34-year-old woman with leadership qualities and is married with a son who is at secondary school. Her husband works in a beauty parlour on a casual basis. In order to contribute toward the household expenses and her son's education, she decided to set up a small grocery stall 8 years ago in the passageway of her home, which is a wooden house on stilts.

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs and other products. Her dream is to have enough capital to set up as a distributor.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Oscar Francisco

texts.es: Oscar de 27 años de edad, habita en casa propia y vive junto a sus padres a quienes siempre busca la forma de apoyarlos en todo lo que se puede y de esa forma salir adelante como una familia unida. Oscar  es un joven trabajador que se dedica a laborar en una gasolinera cercana a su vivienda y además posee una tienda de productos básicos de primera necesidad la cual es atendida por su madre en su casa de habitación la cual le sirve de gran ayuda para generar mayores ingresos económicos en el hogar. Oscar solicita un préstamo por medio de FUSAI con el cual tenga tener la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio ya que es muy necesario tanto para el cómo su familia y con el monto otorgado piensa invertir en productos como: frijoles, maíz, arroz, maicillo  y otros productos más, los cuales son  primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que solicitan más los clientes en una tienda.
texts.en: Oscar, 27 years old, lives in his own house and lives together with his parents, whom he is always looking for ways to support in every way he can and thus move forward as a united family. Oscar is a hardworking young man who works at a gas station near his home and in addition he has a store for basic necessities which is tended by his mother at their house, which is a great help to her to generate more household income. Oscar is applying for a loan through FUSAI, with which to have the economic capacity to stock his business since it is very necessary for both himself and his family and with the amount awarded he plans to invest in products such as: beans, corn, rice, sorghum and other products, which are household staples and which also are the ones that store customers most ask for.

loans.use: invest in products such as: beans, corn, rice, sorghum and other staples.

loans.name: Divino Jesus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DIVINO JESUS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mery, la socia tiene 32 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltero, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, carnes, arroz entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “DIVINO JESUS" communal bank. It is located in the district of Echarate, which belongs to the province of La Convención and Cusco department.

Mery is one member. She is 32 years old, single and has three children. She combines her daily activities with her restaurant business. She has run this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work each day. She wants to be able to continue to work in this way to continue to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like oil, meat and rice amongst others. 

The members are grateful for the awarded loan and promise to comply with the established payments. The member that appears in the attached photo had permission to arrive at the meeting late due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, meat, and rice amongst others.

loans.name: Vilma Maribel

texts.es: Vilma de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos de 20 y 17 años de edad a quienes solo lograron cursar hasta el nivel básico de educación y actualmente ayudan a su madre con el negocio y con lo que está al alcance de sus posibilidades, Vilma no recibe apoyo económica de nadie más  y sola ha logrado sostener y sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su familia. Vilma se dedica desde hace bastante tiempo a su negocio que es una pequeña venta de frutas y granos básicos en puesto a orillas de la carretera cercana a su vivienda y su mayor deseo es incrementar las ventas por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder surtir su inventario y así lograr mayores ganancias, con el monto ella piensa invertir en la compra de: naranjas, mangos, zapotes, aguacates, frijoles, maíz, arroz y otros productos que demandan su clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma, who is 39 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children aged 20 and 17 years. They only managed to study as far as the basic level of education [ninth grade] and currently help their mother with the business and with whatever they are capable of doing. Vilma gets no financial support from anyone else and with a great deal of effort she has managed to support and bring up her family on her own.

For quite some time Vilma has made a living from her business, which is selling fruit and basic grains from a stall at the side of the road near her home. Her biggest desire is to increase her sales and this is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can have a range of stock and so make more profits. She is planning to use the money to buy oranges, mangos, sapota fruit, avocados, beans, corn, rice and other products which the customers of her business ask for.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mangos, sapota fruit, avocados, beans, corn and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, meat and rice amongst others.

loans.name: Sonia Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Jave - Jireh.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 14 y 11 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Sonia con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas, ella tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar en el cual muchos comerciantes ofrece sus productos, sus ventas varían de acuerdo a los días y a las fechas pero le dejan lo suficiente para ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia, lleva más de 10  años en su negocio el cual cada vez que recibe los créditos lo mejora aun mas. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos y zapatillas de varios tipos y modelos. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la institución les brinda muy buenos  servicios. Sus sueños son tener un buen local.
texts.en:
In the La Paz neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known from colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Jave-Jireh" meets every 15 days.

This is where Sonia, 37, lives with her partner and their 2 daughters aged 14 and 11. Their daughters attend school, and her husband works as a merchant.
