With the goal of having her own income to help with the household expenses, Sonia has a business selling shoes and slippers.  She has a post in the center of the city in a place where many merchants offer their products for sale.  Her sales vary according to the days and the time of  year, but they generate enough income for her to help her husband to provide for their family.  She's had more than 10 years of experience with this business, which has improved each time she has received a loan.

Sonia will use this loan to buy shoes and slippers in a variety of types and models.  She has been with her communal bank for more than 2 years, and she likes it because the institution provides very good services.  Her dream is to have a nice store.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old and married with five children. With children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks, and spices.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks, and spices

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, and chips.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, and chips

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ginalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell beverage business in the Philippines and earns additional income by raising pigs. Ginalyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of beverages to sell.

Ginalyn has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of beverages to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and increase stock. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to buy land. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more phone accessories for sale and expand his sales

loans.name: Lagie

texts.en:
Lagie is 51 years old and married with two children; one children is still in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Lagie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, etc.

She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, etc

loans.name: Aracely Petrona

texts.es:
Aracely es una gran mujer, amiga y maestra pues con esfuerzos y mucha preparación todos los días imparte sus conocimientos a sus alumnos en la escuela de su comunidad y para finalizar el día elabora hermosas blusas y delantales de su región, Aracely cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro comprar diferentes tipos de tela y otros materiales que ella utiliza para estas blusas, con esta inversión sus clientela han mejorado y sus ingresos también, ahora ha Aracely le han realizado un pedido de blusas que ella no cuenta ya con tela suficiente para poder surtir mejor este pedido, por tal razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y encajes.
El gran sueño de Aracely es contar con una tienda de artesanías para mejorar su calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is a great woman, friend, and teacher. With effort and a lot of preparation, every day she shares her knowledge with her students in the school in her community. To end the day she makes beautiful blouses and aprons from her region. Aracely says that thanks to her previous loan, she managed to buy different types of fabric and other materials that she uses for these blouses. With this investment her customer base has grown, and her income has grown as well. Now Aracely has received an order of blouses that she no longer has enough fabric for to best fill this order. For this reason she is seeking a new loan to buy fabrics, threads, and laces. 

Aracely's great dream is to have a handcrafts store to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and laces.

loans.name: M. Ikram

texts.en:
M. Ikram is a 34-year-old man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store where he sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets. 

M. Ikram is a father of four children and a single responsible person who has to feed them. He has only one source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark according to the living standard.

M. Ikram wants buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities for making a dowry. For this purpose more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

M. Ikram requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so he can buy utensils and crockery items to sell on a daily basis to generate more income.

M. Ikram is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: to buy crockery and utensils to sell on a daily basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for hog maintenance

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 60 years old and has eight children. She is widowed and has one child who is in school.

Lucy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucy has been in this for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza, a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been selling dry goods in the Philippines for nine years. 

Meliza is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 50 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar,salt,soap,sodas,rice,beans.bread,posho. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,salt,soap,sodas,rice,beans.bread,posho and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, posho

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de carpintería, la socia se siente agradecida y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia continua elaborando  camas, roperos entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera entre otros.
texts.en: The borrower belongs to the SIEMPRE UNIDOS [Always United] community bank, which is located in Cusco province. The borrower continues making a living from her carpentry business. The borrower feels grateful and promises to pay her loan. The borrower continues making beds and wardrobes, among other [products] requested by her customers. The borrower is a responsible person and hard-working, which makes her able to get her family ahead. The borrower requests the loan to purchase wood among other [products].

loans.use: to buy wood among other things

loans.name: Segundo Jesus

texts.es:
SEGUNDO JESUS TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU ESPOSA E HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

SEGUNDO JESUS SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE SIEMBRA Y VENTA DE ALFALFA , DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA REALIZAR EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CULTIVO Y LA COMPRA DE FERTILIZANTES Y ABONOS, DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER UN MAYOR VOLUMEN DE VENTAS Y HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO, MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Segundo Jesus is 41 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and children in his own house in a small community in the urban area of Cayalti which belongs to the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Segundo works in the business of buying and selling alfalfa. His business is located at his house. He has five years experience in the business. He also raises and sells pigs. He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and manure to maintain his crops. Doing this he will obtain a higher volume of sales, make his business grow and be able to improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: Rodulfo has been in the hog fattening business for eight years. He earns a living through this business and is able to sustain his children's schooling. He is availing himself of another loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional pigs for fattening. He is expanding his fattening business due to the increased demand of pork in their town.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS, el socio Felipe continúa dedicándose  a la carpintería, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua elaborando camas, muebles entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de madera entre otros.
texts.en:
Felipe belongs to the “Siempre Unidos” (“Always United”). Felipe continues working as a carpenter. He is thankful for the loan offered and promises to repay the loan in the established installments. 

He continues making beds and furniture, among other things. He is a responsible and persevering person, since this is how he takes his family forward.

He requests the loan to buy wood, among other things.

loans.use: to buy wood, among other things.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS, la socia Teresa continúa  con el negocio de venta de celulares  y cargadores, la socia solicita se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cargadores.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the “Siempre Unidos” (“Always United”) communal bank. She continues working in her business selling cell phones and chargers. She is thankful for the loan offered and promises to repay the loan in the established installments. 

She is a responsible person. She wants to be able to continue working, since this is how she supports her family.

She requests the loan to buy chargers.

loans.use: to buy cell phone chargers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia   pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Margarita continua  trabajando para una empresa privada en el área de venta de productos  de primera necesidad, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the “Siempre Unidos” (“Always United”) communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco and in the department of Cusco.

She continues working for a private business in the area, selling basic necessities. She is thankful for the loan offered and promises to make her repayments in a timely manner. 

She is a responsible and diligent person, since this is how she takes her family forward. 

She requests the loan to buy supplies, such as rice and oil, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 55 years old, single, and works hard to help her brother and sister.

She has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.  Emilia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell for her business.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Anecita has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from her general store and fish vending businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Viviana Brigette

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señorita Viviana, tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera, vive con los padres y por el momento no estudia.
Doña Viviana para tener para sus gastos y para colaborar con los gastos de sus hogar  hace dos años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño Bazar en su casa en el cual vende útiles escolares, ropa, perfumes de muchas marcas, etc.) Trabaja sola, su negocio lo tiene más de 2 años en su casa, el horario de atención es de 8h00 a 20h00, le va muy bien y piensa agrandar su local.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa interior, medias, camisetas, bisutería y útiles escolares. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y pocos requisitos. Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un local más grande con más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular, and visited sea resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first deep-water port in Ecuador and in South America. 

In this place, lives Viviana. She is 19 years old and is single. She lives with her parents and, for the moment, is not in school. 

Viviana started a business two years ago to have money for expenses and to share in the household expenses. She has a small store in her house, where she sells school supplies, clothing, and many brands of perfume, among other things. She works alone. Her business has been in the house for more than two years. She works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. The business is going very well, and she plans to expand her store.

This loan will be used to buy undergarments, socks, shirts, costume jewelry, and school supplies. She is in the loan group for three cycles, and she likes it because the interest rates are low and there are few requirements. 

Her dream is to continue going forward in her business and to have a bigger store with a larger variety of products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, socks, shirts, costume jewelry, and school supplies.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en: Nelsie is 37 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Tudela, where she manages her sari-sari store (mini grocery) business. Through this business, she has managed to augment the income of her family and support the needs of her children in school. Recently, she asked for a loan of PHP 50,000 to restock her store with commodities such as canned goods, condiments, detergent bars, soaps and shampoo. She hopes that she can maintain her member in good standing status with the coop because PMPC was always there to support her financial needs.

loans.use: to restock her store with commodities such as canned goods, condiments, detergent bars, beauty soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is so grateful for the 19,000 PHP loan which she used for maintenance of her tricycle. It helped render safe and consistent service for her passengers. She greatly values her transportation business because it is her only means of providing a living.

She is now again requesting for your help to grant her a 25,000 PHP loan to pay for a new battery and to replace her tricycle's tire. It is important that her vehicle is properly maintained to ensure efficient service and a stable income. Being a widow is not easy, but Merlinda does her best to take care of her business as this enables her to support herself and her aging parents. She is thanking God and you for your good heart for supporting her in her livelihood. 

Merlinda's simple dream is to sustain her transportation business and hopefully acquire another tricycle or a jeepney in the near future. She prays for an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to study the word of God from which she draws strength. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom in school. 

She is in the agricultural business farming corn in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming corn for 10 years now, and has borrowed 30 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 46 years old, married, and has five children to provide for. Along with her husband, she earns her living through a motorcycle transport business. She is aiming for a greater income to provide for all the needs of her family, especially for her children’s education. 

Because of this, she decided to request a loan to buy new tires for her motorcycle so that she can continue to cater to more passengers and increase her income.  Emerita also plans to save money in the future to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to buy new tires for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Jessenia Cecibel

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de  11 y 7  años que estudian en escuela. El cónyuge es cerrajero.
Doña Jessenia para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa, ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella  pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a sus alrededor. Tiene cinco años a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad y quiere incrementar con útiles escolares. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 8 ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo y la facilidad para hacer los créditos. Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular, and visited sea resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first deep-water port in Ecuador and in South America. 

In this place, lives Jessenia. She is 23 years old and is in a relationship, from which she has two children, who are 11 and 7 years old and who study in school. Her partner is a locksmith.

To go forward with her family, Jessenia has a grocery store in her house. In the store, she sells all kinds of products, including rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works everyday from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening, and at times until even later. She spends this time at her business because it is where she likes to be, since in addition to it being where she makes a living, it keeps her entertained and informed about the news that happens nearby. She has spent five years dedicated to this business, and it is how she earns a living.

This loan will be used to supply her store more. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic necessities, and she wants to expand with school supplies. She has been in the loan group for 8 cycles, and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group and because it is easy to get loans. 

Her dream is to continue forward in her business and for her store to grow bigger everyday.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, basic necessities, and school supplies.

loans.name: Ronald Alberto

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive señor Ronald, tiene 20  años y es soltero.    
El señor Ronald para salir adelante tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su mamá le ayuda en su trabajo ya que es su socia, pero por lo general es su mamá quien más atiende ya que él tiene un taxi y hace recorridos y fletes de 6:00 a 13:00 y de 14h00 a 17hh00, tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular, and visited sea resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first deep-water port in Ecuador and in South America. 

In this place, lives Ronald. He is 20 years old and is single. To go forward, Ronald has a grocery store in his house. In the store, he sells all kinds of products, including rice, sugar, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and fruits. He worked everyday from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, and at times until even later. His mother helps him in his work, since she is his partners. In general, though, it is his mother who takes care of the business more, since he has a taxi and he takes trips and loads from 6am to 1pm and from 2pm to 5pm. He has been doing this work for a year, and it he going very well. 

This loan will be used to supply his store more. He is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic necessities. He has been in the loan group for 5 cycles, and he likes it because he has made many friends in the group. 

His dream is to continue going forward in his business and to have his business grow everyday.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en: Eusebia makes a good earning on her farming activities in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she has a high cost of living knowing the price of basic commodities increases. Eusebia approached Paglaum to loan an amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer for her gardening business. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer for her gardening business.

loans.name: Monserrate María

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos de 20, 17, 16, 14 y 8 años, el hijo mayor no estudia, uno se acaba de graduar de bachiller, dos estudian en el colegio, y uno  en escuela. El cónyuge es contratista de una fábrica.
Doña Monserrate es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella  hace diez años empezó un negocio, tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos encebollados (una sopa típica ecuatoriana preparada con albacora o atún fresco, yuca, cebolla, tomate, cilantro y condimentos) se sirve con curtido de cebolla y tomate, chifles y ají o salsa picante al gusto, trabaja los días Sábados  y Domingo  desde las 10h00 hasta las 12h00 y a veces más tarde hasta que se le terminen los alimentos preparados, también venden colas, cervezas, aguas, etc. De lunes a viernes trabaja vendiendo zapatos por catálogos, productos naturales  y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Ella realiza todos estos trabajos esperando mejorar su calidad de  vida para ella y su familia.
Ella invertirá el crédito en comprar mesas, bancos, zapatos y bisutería. Está en el grupo de crédito hace 5 ciclos. Lo que le gusta de la fundación que son bajos los intereses, su sueño que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important and visited resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It also has the first deepwater port in Ecuador and South America. Mrs. Monserrate lives in this city. She is 39 years old and she is in a common-law marriage from which she has five children ages 20, 17, 16, 14, and 8 years old. Her oldest child is not in school, one has just graduated from high school, two are in middle school, and one is in grade school. Her common-law husband is a contractor at a factory. 

Mrs. Monserrate is a very hardworking woman. Ten years ago she started her business. She has a small diner in her home where she prepares delicious "encebollados" (a traditional Ecuadorian soup made with albacore or fresh tuna, cassava, onions, tomato, cilantro, and seasonings). It is served with a relish of onions and tomatoes, banana chips and pepper with hot sauce to taste. She works Saturdays and Sundays from 10am until 12pm and sometimes later until the food runs out. She also sells soft drinks, beer, water, etc. From Monday through Friday she sells shoes through catalogs, natural products and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She does all of this work with the hope of improving the quality of life for her and her family. 

She will invest this loan in buying tables, stools, shoes and miscellaneous goods. This is her 5th loan with this partner. What she likes about the foundation is that interest rates are low. Her dream is that her children will become professionals

It is in the group of credit for 5 cycles. What she likes the foundation that are low interest, their dream that their children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy tables, stools, shoes and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Nelen

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Nelen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nelen is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell.

Nelen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Daid

texts.en:
Daid is 34 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 1 year, Daid has been working hard to manage his tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand his business, Daid has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for sewing, and will help Daid to generate greater profits and have enough materials. Daid hopes that in the future he will be able to have all types of materials. 

Daid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Daid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy materials for sewing so as to generate a better income

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 54 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, Rocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Rocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 64 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Feliciana is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Feliciana has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from peanut-butter making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is so grateful she has continuously received help to sustain operations of her general store, which enables her to meet her family's daily needs and send her children to school. Although at times she struggles in collecting receivables from customers who buy on credit, her faith in God and positive attitude drives her to persevere in life.

Dolores trusts that she will be able to access another PHP 19,000 loan to increase her product inventory. To survive in the competition in general store business she sees to it that she offers almost all the essential food items in her store to attract more customers. She is thanking God and you for continually supporting her livelihood. She values her store so much as this is her source of income to cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Dolores' simple dream is like every mother's dream, to send all her children to college, thus allowing them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods to sell at her store.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to sell on a wholesale basis within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 50 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF prior this loan. She has been running the general store for 29 years and also earns an income from fishing. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 49 years old and is married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Natividad has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending and fattening pigs.

Natividad aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jemema

texts.en:
Jemema is 56 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Jemema has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Leah works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell. Leah has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 33 years old and married with one child in school.

April has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

April has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future April would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Felicitas has a passenger tricycle business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

Felicitas has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 42 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Rosalina has a shrimp-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of shrimp to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of shrimp to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 64 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julieta has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Julieta has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and widowed with one child. Teresita works very hard to provide for the family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Teresita has been in this business for 18 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Fortunatus, who is in his late 20s, is married with one child. He has been running a business selling chips. He works from eleven in the morning until after midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Fortunatus is a member of the loan group, “Mti mrefu,” comprised of three members who will all hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

Fortunatus is requesting a loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and meat. This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and meat. He repaid all of his loans successfully. Fortunatus is doing fine with his loans and appreciates Kiva support. He used the profits from his prior loans to cover his household expenses. Fortunatus dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and meat

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four children. For the past two years, she has operated a business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. Hadija’s business is located in a good area and her greatest business challenge is insufficient funds. Hadija describes herself as honest. 

Hadija is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. Hadija hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes se está dedicando a estudiar, trabajar. Ella está en busca de un mejor bienestar para ella y su familia.
Su sueño preciado es ser una buena profesional en el área de salud, es por ello que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios y así seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Lourdes is dedicated to studying and working. She is doing her best to provide for the welfare of herself and her family.

Her greatest wish is to become a successful professional in the healthcare field. For this reason, she is studying for a degree in Nursing so that she can grow and move forward.

Lourdes is requesting this loan in order to pay the fees associated with her studies. As a result, she can continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 55 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, shampoo, soap, etc.

Alita has been in this business for 16 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 48 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Lelanie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lelanie has been in this business for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married. For the past 10 years, she has sold rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from operating a general store. Tessie works hard to support her family. 

Tessie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a farmland business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josefina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill for her farmland business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia is 42 years old and married with two children. One of her children is currently in school. For the past 14 years, Nenia has run a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenia is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael is 45 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Michael has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar,salt,soap,sodas,rice,beans.bread,posho. 

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,salt,soap,sodas,rice,beans.bread,posho and will help Michael to generate greater profits and increase stock. Michael hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock. 

Michael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Michael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans,bread, posho

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Veronica se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere abrir una tienda donde pueda vender los productos naturales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica continues to operate her business of selling natural products. As a member, she has demonstrated that she is a hardworking woman as a result of this business. She wants to open a store where she can sell natural products.

Veronica is requesting a loan in order to buy natural products. She is pleased to receive the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cristita works hard to support her family. She runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Cristita is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a 57 year old Lebanese single woman living alone. She operates a grocery store since 2010. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work, with the aim to develop her work and to benefit from it. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new merchandises for her business to increase productivity and enhance her income. Rihab insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able to develop always her business.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man, with 7 children. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail business where he sells fish and prawns. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and prawns. He hopes that in the future, he will be a large scale supplier.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish and prawns

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia works hard to support her family. She is married and has business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Nicasia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nicasia has been in this business for 15 years now.

Nicasia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food and pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. 

This is her fourth  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food and pay school fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and general store businesses. Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business
